Reviews.Title: “VERY CLEAN & GREAT STAFF!”
Reviews.Author: gioflight
Reviews.Content: I Would not hesitate to recommend " THE HILTON GARDEN INN MONTREAL" to anyone. GREAT STAFF! THE rooms and not to mention the whole hotel is very clean, even the LOBBY WASHROOMS were impeccably clean not like some hotels that concentrate only on the rooms being clean! Being a fork lover, I also enjoyed the culinary experience of the cozy restaurant .....excellent food, good variety and courteous professional staff. Merci, to all the staff! Gio.

Reviews.Title: “Doorstep to downtown”
Reviews.Author: chak811
Reviews.Content: If you have kids who attend McGill University, this is the place to stay in downtown Montreal, when you visit them. Rooms are clean, roomy and reasonably priced. You need your room key to activate the elevators, a security feature I like very much. Room service is prompt, but starts only at 8 am. Their own restaurant quality is good. You can park and lock your vehicle in the basement, watch out you have a large SUV or sedan; parking is very tight. The good news is, you won't need to take your car out since all downtown attractions are walking distance. Overall, will not hesitate to come back again during my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: lone_palm
Reviews.Content: I visit Montreal several times a year for business, but have not stayed in this property before. It is a longer walk to the office I work in, but I like Hilton hotels and as winter was over I gave it a shot. Was pleased that I did - the rate was competitive for that area of town, the room was a good size, and was clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. I didn't feel any concern walking around the neighbourhood by myself in the evening, or in the hotel. Nevertheless, I appreciated having to use a keycard to operate the elevator. The Internet was complimentary, and was stable in my room on the 6th floor. I will definitely return to this hotel when the weather is more suitable for a longer walk.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Luciano11
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn, Montreal... great stay, great service, rooms very clean, well run hotel. Thank you staff

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Bahstin
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel if you're visiting Montreal. The rooms are spacious and spotless and the beds are very comfortable. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: lav74
Reviews.Content: Big clean room with microwave and small refrigerator and in a great part of Montreal. Adjacent to McGill, the Plateau and Downtown. There are lots of restaurants nearby and there is a big grocery store less than one block away. Wife and kids loved the swimming pool. I was able to park free overnight on one of the residential streets just a couple blocks north of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “TrÃ¨s Bon!”
Reviews.Author: dontcallmecas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends in October for 2 nights. It was everything you would expect from a Hilton Garden Inn: spacious, clean rooms and comfortable beds but nothing too extravagant. The room was a bit pricy but the hotel is centrally located so it was worth it for a short trip. We did not have to drive or spend money on cab fare. There are many different attractions within walking distance. As many other reviewers have mentioned, the staff were also very friendly and helpful. Iâ€™d stay again for a weekend get away but not longer than that unless we got the right deal. It is centrally located but you really do pay for the Hilton name and in my opinion the Garden Innâ€™s are nothing out of the ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: tman12
Reviews.Content: Usually would stay at Chez Swann hotel, but it gets expensive on the weekends (see my review on tripadvisor), so ended up staying here for the first time, because of reviews and price. It was a good hotel for the price point...... Here is the good...... 1. Great location on Rue Sherbrooke, near McGill University 2. Newer hotel, so nice and clean, not too many nicks and scratches 3. Very good work out and pool facility, has 3 elliptical, 3 treadmills, dumbells up to 50 lbs, free weights with bench, pool and jacuzzi, there is a steam room in mens locker room. You will need your room key to access this area 4. Rooms are large, nothing special. Pretty much like everyother hotel room. My room only had a shower (no tub) 5. Neutrogena toiletries 6. free bottle of water in room 7. Free wifi that has excellent bandwidth 8. Friendly staff 9. Good check in and check out 10. You hear just a bit of noise from the street, but pretty well sound proof. I didnt hear noise from neighboring rooms 11. Need room key to access floors in elevator. Good security measure 12. Price point was great for what you get The not so good..... Nothing was bad at this hotel.... Just some things to keep in mind 1. This is a hotel/apartment complex, so you have to keep straight the elevator banks. They are well marked if you happen across the apartment elevators 2. Elevators have a pretty obnoxious beep/buzz. when you push of floors. Also you need your room key to access floors. This is good for security but bad for ease of use

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: Tony S
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at this hotel and I was truly impressed by the cleanliness. The staff was courteous and knowledgable about the city. The hotel's location is close to most attractions and reasonably priced. I'll definitely book next time I'm in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Splatravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night for a hockey game March 4/12. Friendly staff, knowledgable about the downtown area and gave options for transport, eats, etc.. Usual Hilton quality rooms with very clean washrooms and clean comfortable beds. Free Wi Fi and bottled water. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good base in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: schweiz2816
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn is a good, reliable hotel in downtown Montreal. The rooms are spacious, clean and have all the amenities you need (safe, coffee maker, iron, wifi, large comfortable beds etc). We could hear some streetnoise (it was frosh week at the universities), but nothing too disturbing. One minor drawback is that there aren't a lot of restaurants in the immediate area (although there is a very nice local coffee shop nearby for breakfast and lunch). It was a bit more removed from the main shopping / restaurant area than I had realized, but still only ~a 10-15 minute walk. In the summer, the hotel restaurant has a cute little sidewalk patio that we quite enjoyed in the evenings. The food was decent too. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Curious_Canucks
Reviews.Content: Great location - speedy check-in - very large room with comfortable bed. Free wi-fi. Clean & spacious bathroom. Room service were fast and very polite. Try the Poutine - it is very good! AS for the view, i'ven seen better, but for a business trip.... not really an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: Mothergooses
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before and had a wonderful time. this time was great as well!! the staff is always very helpful and we loved our room! Clean and fresh and very welcoming! we love the location of the hotel cause its central! We finally got to try the hotel restaurant this time and enjoyed our meals. Great service and not over priced for what we had! all in all a wonderful second visit! we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend gateway”
Reviews.Author: sinmalta
Reviews.Content: Our weekend was punctuated with spa treatments, gym and fitness, shopping and great meals. All are within easy walking distance of the Hilton or within the property. The room was lovely and fresh. Staff were very polite and friendly, and made the extra effort to help us with whatever questions we had. Even though the hotel was full, we never felt rushed or neglected and always received individual service. Well done all.

Reviews.Title: “Just be selective about your room!”
Reviews.Author: rainydayinnyc
Reviews.Content: We checked in and no sooner did we arrive in room 1014 than notice that the room was vibrating. Extremely loud humming and the walls were vibrating. We went downstairs, we were told it was the room right under the hot tub, and we were moved immediately to room 521 which was quiet and bigger than the last room! My only thought is why they rent theroom at all, it was awful. BUT, as I said, they were extremely accommodating and it was no issue to move . Plus the rooms were ready at noon, and they let us check in well before 3. Pool area was nice with a big hot tub, but crowded so we didn't use it unfortunately. I also agree with other comenters that bringing up the pool towels from the room is odd and we only knew to do it inadvance because we read it here. Rooms were clean, bathroom was a little tight in room 1014 but spacious in 521. Everyone was extremely pleasant and helpful and the rate was good. There are a few grocery stores close by which is nice for water and snacks to keep in the room. We are from NYC so we walk a lot, probably not close enough to Old Montreal if you are out of shape. There isn't much in the way of public transport from the airport so plan to take a cab if you aren't a walker. We would definitely stay here again. Free wifi, nice rooms, friendly staff, interesting dining choices close by. Just be sure you don't get the vibrating room! We don't give it five stars because we reserve that for the super special places. We look forward to returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: tvm111
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a few times before and each stay has been wonderful. The staff is friendly and polite and were very helpful to recommend some great places to visit in the city. The property has a great location, beds are comfortable and rooms are a nice size. The restaurant is also very good. Cleanliness is always a big concern of mine when staying in hotels, but there was no issue with that here... Rooms are clean, so are the hallways and the fitness center too. I would definitely recommend this hotel for business and/or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Wlfsbrg01
Reviews.Content: I only spent a weekend in Montreal, so I stayed here for one night. I got to Montreal early in the morning, but spent the entire day out and about taking care of what I had come for - I ended up checking in around 5:00pm. I freshened up a bit for an hour or two, then left for dinner and a night out. I ended up getting back to the hotel at around 4:00am - so my experience was really limited to only Sunday morning - and yet, I still ended up with a really bad taste in my mouth. I had really unpleasant interactions with the hotel's staff from the moment I arrived, and was barked at for stopping in front of the hotel to unload my luggage (in the guest load/unload zone), all the way to check-out. I didn't take any pictures of the room, as it was identical to the pictures that are already up on this site. Instead, I have provided here two very condensed anecdotes of what I am referring to when I say that my experience with this hotel's staff was surprisingly disappointing. The information booklet in my room listed no information about room service for breakfast, but it did indicate that there was a little shop in the lobby that sold food. I just needed something quick and easy, so I figured I would just run downstairs and grab a muffin or something. The shop ended up being a closet and not having any food, which is fine. So I checked with the front desk if there was any way to get something sent up to my room. I spoke with a certain Andrew, who was incredibly condescending and rude. I was told that the only way to find out about what is available is to physically go to the restaurant and talk to them, as "there is no food at the front desk that I can eat, clearly". He said that he could not call the restaurant on my behalf and that if I wanted food, I would have to call from my room. On the way back to my room from this unexpectedly rude experience, I got stuck in the elevator. Now I realize that this is the fault of no one, I certainly do not blame it on the hotel staff. However, it is the way that they handled the problem that was so disappointing. We called on the emergency phone in the elevator and were connected to the front desk - they were rude and failed to appreciate how inconvenient (and potentially frightening) being trapped in an elevator for 30 minutes might be. The other guests and I were told that they would send someone to verify...The elevator continued to run up and down to various floors by itself, but would not open its doors. In the end, we got off at the 11th floor - and in the mean time, no one had been notified. More rude staff (cleaning) were trying to get in the elevator as we were getting off - indicating that not even staff had been notified of the situation, and providing yet another opportunity for unpleasant staff interaction. Look, the hotel itself is fine - the location is great, the rooms are clean (except for some unpleasant long hairs found in my bed), and the price is right. Just don't expect any more than that. Honestly, it takes very little for a hotel to be clean and well-located - it is the service and attention to detail that distinguishes one hotel from another. The staff at this property were more akin to an interstate motel than a four-star Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hillton”
Reviews.Author: shawchessplayer
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 5th floor overlooking a road junction. And so there was some road noise. Not that much, but enough to irritate. The poor rating for the rooms is purely because of the noise. The rooms were a good size, and the beds very comfortable. There was a micowave which was useful for us. I asked at reception if I could borrow two plates, and I was sent to the restaurant. Eventually after wandering around a busy restaurant, I managed to attract the attention of a busy waitress, who duly obliged. What happened to service ? Actually, exactly the same happened in the Boston Hilton a few days later so it maybe it is company policy. There is a pleasant swimming pool on the top floor, which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Another business visit”
Reviews.Author: LAF_20
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Arriving at 8 AM, the staff managed to find us rooms earlier than normal check in. Great prices on martini's from 4 to 7. The breakfast is a bit pricey but very good. The corner rooms are larger and have a bigger bathroom. If you are facing Sherbrooke St, you may want to ask for a higher floor. I was on the 3rd floor and could hear traffic a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff”
Reviews.Author: bostonsig
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend getaway to the Fete de Neiges in Montreal. The hotel is perfectly located near the main areas of the city to make walking to the shopping district about 10 minutes away and the staff is superb. We took a cab from the hotel to the Fete and my friend left his cell phone in the cab. Not knowing how to reach the driver we called the hotel and they tracked him down and got the phone back for us by the time we returned. Breakfast with the crepe of the day is amazing (today was chocolate and banana, yesterday was raspberry coulee and fresh pineapple!!)

Reviews.Title: “one of the best nights sleep.....”
Reviews.Author: drutuk
Reviews.Content: I've stopped here twice now, both times during the F1 GP... its a very nice well located hotel. the Breakfast is good value, delicious and very well presented, the staff are polite friendly and very helpful. The rooms are big, the bed is very comfy - one of the best hotel beds i know!!! I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: chezlouie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hilton Garden Inn for one night for a client meeting in Montreal.I really liked the friendly service in this hotel. The hotel's amenities are modern, and the room was huge and spacious. I especially like the central location of the hotel in the downtown area. Great choice of hotel in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Dov A
Reviews.Content: I had read good reviews about the Hilton Garden Inn on Sherbrooke and decided to try it. The hotel is very nice and very clean, but is as bland as you get. I think that I will stick with the Omni from now on. The level of service and size of rooms is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around stay”
Reviews.Author: flaii
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay of two nights. Arriving at 12:30am, I was greeted warmly by the staff, who already had my room key ready for me. He kindly asked if this was my first time at the hotel, and since it was, he described the various features of the hotel and where to find them, and also asked me if I wanted a wake up call. I appreciated how he was proactive with this information and service. I had booked an "executive suite" because of an HHonors promotion. The extra room in the suite basically just held a table and four chairs, and a second TV, wet bar, and second fridge, so I guess its design is more for holding meetings than relaxing. As an HHonors Gold member, I was given two complimentary bottles of water every day, and I appreciated that the front desk clerk told me this so I didn't have any confusion if I would be charged for it or not. I was also given complimentary full breakfast in the restaurant downstairs. HHonors rules state that Gold members get continental breakfast, so this property went beyond by extending full breakfast. That included the continental breakfast buffet, as well as a cooked to order item (eggs any way, waffles, crepe of the day). The main server at the restaurant was extremely warm and friendly. Bed was comfortable, and I loved the walk-in shower. Other nice amenities are complimentary copies of the Globe and Mail, and a business center accessible by the room key where there were computers and a printer for guest use. The location is good. You can walk to Vieux Montreal in about 20-25 minutes, McGill is just a couple blocks away. The Place des Arts metro station is around the corner on the next block, and I also discovered several bus lines at the corner of the hotel (I used Google Maps to plot out bus routes using the "Transit" function). The immediate area isn't so interesting, and I didn't try the few restaurants nearby. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay!!”
Reviews.Author: kepkypeos
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this wonderfull and centrally located property for New Years. The Hotel was very clean and the staff amazing! They had extra security for the evening, including Montreal Police on site, and only registered guests were allowed on the premises, WHAT A GREAT IDEA!!! it was an icreadible 4 days at this property. Highly recomended!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lizfurnis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January and got the 2 Queen beds and bed and breakfast package. It was definitely worth spending the extra 20 bucks for breakfast everyday at the hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The room was spacious and clean. The bathroom was super clean and looked brand new. The room had great up to date decor. I would come and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely poor service - New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: DAV2933
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived at this hotel in late afternoon of December 31st. Upon checking in we were told that we absolutely had to wear thick blue plastic bracelets for our entire stay. When asking if anything can be substituted for this the hotel manager literally attacked us with enforcement. He began yelling through the entire lobby that rules need to be followed and proceeded to ask us to leave...all because I asked if we can carry the bracelets instead of wear them since they clearly would not have matched our formal attire for the evening out. As a seasoned traveler I stay in many hotels all over the continent, both for work and pleasure. This was the first time anyone reacted so hostly and rudely to suggestions about a policy. Perhaps on a regular evening when you don't have to interact with management this hotel is okay, but I would definitely not recommend it on a holiday or a busy long weekend. I suspect they cater to a younger crowd and are used to disrespecting their clients, so beware. Even though the room was tidy and the location was great, this kind of interaction upon checking in would undoubtedly ruin anyone's experience.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptionally great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Rogerstehr
Reviews.Content: Stayed with another family to celebrate the New Year! We noticed that when we checked in there were a lot of people and began to wonder if noise would be a problem. We were greeted and checked in quickly and efficiently. As night time came we noticed ample security guards ensuring that safety and noise level would be controlled by the hotel. We felt safe and slept without any disruption. We also had the opportunity to experience dinner and felt it was exceptionally delicious. The kids had a great time with the salt water pool and the cinema room was made available to them. The room was quite spacious even with our 2 boys sharing our room. We will definitely return next year with our family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Room was great but other areas had flaws”
Reviews.Author: Barella3602
Reviews.Content: Rooms were as expected, clean and tidy. Temp was good, plenty of room, etc. My negatives: was given terrible directions from the front desk on where to buy gas - an hour + later, late at night and in the cold weather I found my way back to hotel now with 1/16 of a tank. I then went back to the very same man and told him and he was oh yeah I did tell you to turn and shouldn't have... Lesson learned is to refuel in the US before crossing the border. FYI the gas station is on Sherbrooke about 3 mins down the road, take a right on to Sherbrooke . Secondly I expected overpriced food at the hotel restaurant but I ran down to grab two bagels for my traveling companion and I before we left on a tour and $12 later I had two of the worst bagels ever eaten. Next time run to the Holiday Inn and grab something from their coffee shop - I think they have breakfast sandwiches for $2.99. Or try the cafe across from there - awesome hot chocolate! Overall nothing wrong with the hotel and their half priced martinis M thru F are a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: SarahH222
Reviews.Content: Great location and beautiful hotel. Only complaint is that when we checked in, we were given a room that hadn't been cleaned from the previous visitor...we were upgraded to a better room though, so that's a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: givemeahug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December 2011 for 4 days. The facilities were clean, up to date, and the bathroom was a beautiful large glass encased shower. I love hotels that only have a shower, and it's tastefully done. The hotel room had a minifridge, and a microwave, which was super helpful for stocking with breakfast essentials! It helps save money. Right across the street is an Organic healthfood supermarket, which was very well stocked with all of the essentials. Being vegetarians, this was immensely helpful for us. The concierge was knowledgeable and everyone was friendly and helpful. We arrived from the airport by taxi, which was $38CAN one way. The hotel elevator only operates with your room key card, which added some security. I felt very safe in this hotel. The bed was extremely comfortable. I slept well the entire stay! Overall, I liked this so much, I think I will be returning to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem of a restsurant”
Reviews.Author: Artichokeanyone
Reviews.Content: The restaurant menu is surprisingly varied and interesting. I sat at the bar and ordered a martini - special tapas and martini half price menu before 7 pm weekdays. Of course no choice of liquor brand and smaller quantity but at half price who is counting? The tapas I chose - salt cod cake - were excellent, the cod taste and texture very much in evidence in the crisp cakes. The dinner menu special included a rack of lamb for $39. It could have fed 3 people and you can call me names but I ate the whole succulent and perfectly cooked and seasoned 8 ribs and gnawed on the bones as if alone in my own kitchen! I stay here twice a year and have never regretted it!

Reviews.Title: “Ah, the perfect bed!”
Reviews.Author: loo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Dec 2-5, 2011. This is simply the best bed I have ever slept in. My partner and I have different ideas of the perfect bed, but we both slept perfectly on this one. I can't ever remember a hotel room where I didn't have some adjustments to make in regards to at least one of: the room temperature and/or ventilation, the pillows, the bed, the linens or the noise levels. I had none of these problems in this hotel. We walked in, settled in, and fell asleep. It was so simple, just like it should be - and we are both light sleepers. Our room was facing the street. Unlike in almost all other hotels, the freezer in the minifridge actually works. It is a bit slow to freeze, but it does work. There were also plenty of accessible electrical outlets. Our room, a King, was absolutely huge. It included a couch, 2 armchairs, a hassock and coffee table as well as the designer desk chair. Excellent water pressure and plenty of hot water on the 7th floor A couple of minor issues. The lightbulbs were not really bright enough for me as bedside lamps. However, I did not complain about them. It's possible they would have offered better ones if I'd asked. But I do think stronger bulbs should be standard issue, especially in hotels which offer Seniors rates, as does this one. We did not requrest a disability-friendly room, but ours did have the disability signifier on the door. For those of you who may require this feature, please note that our room did not have a grab bar for the toilet, which it really should have. I am not sure if this was just our room or whether they are all like this, but if it is an issue for you, you should inquire about it. I would have appreciated a night light in the bathroom. Staff were friendly and accommodating although we did not have a lot to do with them. We did not try the food, so can't comment. 5 miute walk from the Place des Arts subway station. There was always a cab waiting at the door. Many restaurants in the area. The challenge for this hotel will be to see if it can maintain this level of quality as the years go by and the facilities age.. I have stayed in several Montreal hotels, always chosen after much deliberation and consulting reviews at tripadvisor, but this one was definitely the best value overall, and the best sleep in particular.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value in a good location, typical Hilton quality.”
Reviews.Author: Omillett
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here in early October. Was a reasonably priced hotel for Montreal. Good location, close to everything and transit. The room was perfectly adequate and typical Hilton standards. The room had a few extra amenities like a fridge & microwave which are helpful if you're there for a few nights. My only complaint was that at 2300h, you have to ring to get buzzed into the foyer, and its a bit nippy to stand waiting for the night manager to let you in. Overall, this is good bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Emilee S
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel from Dec 2nd - 4th, 2011. Staff were helpful but not overly friendly. Didn't eat at the hotel restaurant so couldn't say whether it's good or bad. Our room was very clean and we got fresh towels for the 2nd day. The room was smaller then what was expected but big enough for the two of us. Asked for a room with a view when we got there, but they couldn't accomodate, so our view was kinda crappy. The hotel is in a great location right downtown, close to lots of restaurants that are within walking distance (even in the cold weather), and about a 15 minute walk to the shopping area. Parking at the hotel was pricey. Cost us $50 to park for 2 nights, which we thought was a little bit costly. Overall, a nice, clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tdl119
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hilton property in a great central Montreal location. Rooms are very clean and confortable, and they contain a microwave oven, small refrigerator and a coffee maker. I don't usually eat in hotel restaurants, but the restaurant here has really good food. Nice if you get in late and don't want to go out. Staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “good to share”
Reviews.Author: DAN L
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel, my first time travel to Monteal, stayed for three nights, fair price, and very clean nice room and facilities. Good services. I love the breakfast, variety choices, although you have to pay for it, but worth to do that. Parking a little bit expensive, but all the downtown area are like this. Overall a nice hotel to stay and walkable in summer to all the good places around downtown. Walkable to Chinatown as well :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, clean in good location”
Reviews.Author: Engelmeyerc
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in a room with a king size bed in mid November and had no major complaints. We did not use the restaurant - there are many very good restaurants, cafes and pubs within walking distance. The gym is bright and has all equipment in good working order. Mouldy smell from bathroom drains should be addressed. The cover sheet for the king size bed was queen size and did not cover the width of the top duvet, which is not changed after each guest - sanitary issue.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: jg20042003
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much. I've stayed at the delta two doors down and the hallways and rooms made me wished I'd paid $100 more night somewhere else. I chose the Hilton because the location is terrific. It was very affordable so my expectations were low. But found it to be clean, new, and quiet. Would very much recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for Walking To Diversity ...”
Reviews.Author: WMD_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 3 nights in this newish property located perfectly within walking distance of many attractions (universities, Old Montreal, Montreal underground (shopaholics beware), theaters/clubs, countless dining options, ethnic and socially diverse neighboorhoods. Great on-premise bar/dining. Park your car in the underground garage on arrival (very reasonable daily rate) and leave it parked until final departure. Bonus point: upper-floor atrium-style pool, with wonderful outside deck w/chaise lounges/tables, overlooking busy thoroughfare below. Subway stops are everwhere. A clean and very walkable city. No real need to learn the French language. 3 nights/days was about right to get an initial feel for Montreal. We will return again, and will stay again at the Hilton Garden Inn.

Reviews.Title: “High times at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: ScottyMontana
Reviews.Content: This is a really great property. Very modern facilities throughout, nice clean spacious rooms, free internet everywhere, great restaurant...although breakfast should never cost $17, but it does! And the location is really fantastic. A bit on the east side of downtown but it you are doing anything that is taking place at the Place des Arts, this is a great place to stay. Staff were all exceptionally friendly (It helps when you pull up in a classic Corvette;)) but seriously, staff were really, really great. Don't hesitate to stay here if the location works with your Montreal plans.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mothergooses
Reviews.Content: My family stayed there during the weekend and we had a tremendous time. From our checkin, the front desk staff was welcoming and very very helpful! The room was well laid out, very clean and welcoming! All in all we will be staying there next summer when were back in beautiful Montreal!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: pauldemers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located in downtown Montreal on Sherbrooke Street, close to all the activities. A short walk away, you have access to the "Quartier des spectacles" and Ste. Catherine Street which is good. Check-in at the Hilton Garden Inn Montreal Centre-ville was fast. Rooms are fairly large with a desk area, a mini-fridge, a microwave and coffee-maker. Bathroom was on the small side but well planned so it was not an issue. Large double shower with marble top vanity. Internet is free of charge in the room. There is a small restaurant/bar on the ground floor which I tried for breakfast. It was good... usual breakfast items with the choice of continental or full hot breakfast. Most likely I would stay back at this hotel on a future trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “A cut above the usual Hilton Garden Inn”
Reviews.Author: placerite
Reviews.Content: We have come to expect a certain constant level of service and surroundings at the Hilton Garden Inns in the USA. This particular Hilton Garden Inn in Montreal was absolutely a cut above. The property was very tasteful and clean. Our room was great; we enjoyed watching life move on the street. The restaurant and bar were welcoming. We stayed four nights and were not disappointed in any way. The staff were always helpful even if it meant recommending a nearby place to eat instead of their hotel's restaurant. If we returned to Montreal, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly more expensive, but worth the extra”
Reviews.Author: Teresa12345678
Reviews.Content: Cost is a little more than hotels on the same block,but this hotel is new,spacious and very bright. Starbucks coffee is appreciated. Hotel restaurant is not your typical Hilton garden inn dinning room. Loved the sweet potato gnocchi and the thin crust pizzas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for Montreal Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Chris044
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel in ocotber. First of all the room was really nice, with a good and confortable King size bed. The room was really clean and a good size. The hotel location is aboslutely perfect, it a walking distance from boulevard St Catherine (5-10 min) and Montreal business district, 5-10 min from the boulevard St Laurent were you will find many bars and restaurant, and 5 min to the place des arts district. The gym are and the swimming pool / wirlpool located on the 11th floors are nice and you have a nice view all around. The value was definitively really good for Montreal, and I will definitively goes back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: BMurf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel October 2011. The parking was a little confusing but the doorman was very freindly and informed us we had to register at the hotel before being able to park in the hotel garage. The room itself was very clean. The mattress on the bed was very firm, like sleeping on a sack of flour, but we had a good night sleep. The hotel is not close to, but within walking distance of the shopping district and Old Montreal. The staff in the hotel restaurant were very freindly, the meals were very expensive but very good. Overall we enjoyed our stay and had a great time walking and shopping in Montreal. We look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “LEAFS WIN!!..HOTEL 1ST CLASS ALL THE WAY”
Reviews.Author: robideux b
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note on the exceptional service we received at this hotel..the rooms were nice and comfortable...the front desk took care of all our questions....it was in walking distance to many of Montreals night life scenes. A ride to the casino was $20 including tip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: IHAIM
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to have excellent facilities. It has been built to perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Like a regular HGI, only taller”
Reviews.Author: wildthing271
Reviews.Content: Another day in Montreal, another hotel (see the intro to my Sofitel review). As a regular HIlton guest, a couple of nights in this property were required to keep me on track to retain my status for 2012. The hotel is part of a block at the top end of Montreal, located on Sherbrooke. I arrived late, but the welcome was friendly. I am not sure what I expected, but the room was 100% HGI. The layout, furniture etc was exactly as it would be in a 3 story HGI in Oklahoma - except this was a city centre tower block. I don't know I expected something else, and I did not mind what I found, but it felt strange being in a high-rise! The only real difference to the HGIs I know was that there was only a shower in the bathroom - no tub, which was frustrating. But the shower was powerful, the towels fluffy, with the normal HGI Neutrogena toiletries. The bed was comfortable, and internet free, plus TSN show the Formula 1, so I could watch the Grand Prix (something that is not always possible if in the US!!). Breakfast was the standard HGI breakfast in the lobby bar area. I did not eat in the hotel of an evening, but breakfast was tasty. After breakfast I went out sightseeing in Montreal, gudied by a map and directions from a very helpful concierge. A good hotel - no major faults, so recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Can't do better for the money”
Reviews.Author: JackandJill1970
Reviews.Content: Positive Great location Surprisingly big room Well appointed Courteous staff Quiet Slight negative Pricey parking and snacks

Reviews.Title: “Not a repeat”
Reviews.Author: RubenNYC
Reviews.Content: Average city hotel with below average service. Front desk staff was indifferent, at best. Room and facilities were average, location reasonable. Not recommended, considering all the many better options available in Montreal at this price range.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best HGIs; Great Location for Mixed Biz/Leisure Travel”
Reviews.Author: wtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hilton Garden Inn for 3 nights whilst in Montreal on business. My spouse came with me and spent the days wondering through Montreal while I was working. The location is excellent, next to the financial district, entertainment district, and at the foot of McGill's campus. It was a 5 to 10 min walk to a metro station, depending on your pace. The location sells the hotel, but the staff, cleanliness, and service were all top notch - even above Hilton's generally good standards. My one complaint is that the windows need to be washed. Yes, the weather has been pretty bad, but the construction next door has meant a good bit of dust, so it would be a good idea to wash the outside of the windows more frequently. My other complaint is that one cannot open the windows, which is usually a no-go for me. I will stay at this hotel on my next trip to Montreal. It was really a great one!

Reviews.Title: “it was great getting the last room for that night...”
Reviews.Author: Jillian M
Reviews.Content: If you knew your shower didn't work would you still let people use it? my boyfriend and I took a one night trip and decided to stay here. There was one room open and we took it. With no warning, the shower flooded our whole room into the lobby ceiling and all into our room. 10 gallons of water out of our carpet later, at 1130 at night we finally got some sleep. The next day everyone was very nice, but they knew the drain didn't work. Next time, just don't offer the room.

Reviews.Title: “exactly what you expect from a hilton”
Reviews.Author: georgetown_minky
Reviews.Content: The room and facility was spotless and very well maintained Internet access is wired and wireless and free The business center had working computers and free printing The only standard critism I have is that their resturant is SOOOO expensive. My colleague and I had breakfast and it came out to $40!!!! Another small annoyance, the about half the channels displayed in the guide was available for hotel guests, so I just used the up and down channel selector. Watch out for MAJOR delays due to all the fall construction downtowna and generally everywhere on the way to the airport. I took a taxi and suggest you do the same since they know all the shortcuts.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: eefrat
Reviews.Content: I'm visiting MANY Hilton brand hotels throughout the year and this Garden Inn is an excellent one. The facility is quite new and the service is very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton Garden Inn experience in North America”
Reviews.Author: nomadRick
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a big surprise. Went there with my wife to watch the pro cycling races. We took our bikes and were concerned that we would have trouble storing them in a typical downtown hotel room. No problem here! Not only was the room large enough to fit the bikes - around 400 sq. ft? - but it was clean and modern and included a mini fridge. The restaurant was excellent and the service was top notch. Great location near McGill and Mont Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: furballs
Reviews.Content: Just a one-night stay in this property, but a great one. The on-site restaurant had some excellent food choices that night (sweet potato gnocci was great), staff very friendly. Like all HGIs it's not the fanciest around, but it covers all the basics very well. Good bed, free internet. Didn't have time for b'fast in the morning, but they were happy to grab me a paper bag and let me toss some pastries in with some coffee for a nominal amount. Friendly staff, short walk to anywhere, good location. Maybe a 10-minute walk to the train station, 5 minutes to the shopping districts on Ste. Catherine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location downtown”
Reviews.Author: hapeit
Reviews.Content: Great location and close to McGill University. The staff was very polite and helpful. I didn't have to be concerned that I don't speak French. Stay here if you need to be close to downtowm.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: loveoffoodfranklin
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Comfortable bed and good breakfast menu. Parking expensive but there isn't any alternative. Very tight parking space.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunny182
Reviews.Content: Good overall hotel. Location was excellent and the rooms were clean and a fair size. The rooftop pool area was a nice bonus too. One annoyance was they kept bothering us to be out of the room by 12pm sharp and refused to give us a late checkout. They called the room several times and sent someone by to make sure we were out. We had friends next door who were staying an extra night so we just moved our stuff into their room and hung out for a bit. When we left for lunch a couple of hours later we noticed our original room hadn't been touched - my point being, I don't know why all the harassment to get out of the room was so necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: LAF_20
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptional. It is clean and the staff is very friendly. My room was a good size with king size bed. The bathroom was a bit small but that was the one and only minor drawback. The hotel lounge is great and has a very nice terrace. The street traffic is quite busy but very nice none the less. Ask for Amelie as a server. She is fantastic. The food service is also excellent

Reviews.Title: “Slightly pricey but 99% spot-on”
Reviews.Author: verychoosy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my god-daughter prior to her course at McGill University (10 minutes away). Very clean (though an unfortunate whiff of bathrooms in my room), all staff generally very friendly, helpful and professional, food and drink fine (but pricey), facilities good. A safe, modern hotel with no quirks. Would recommend it as such.

Reviews.Title: “Good, consistent accomodation and services as part of the Hilton brand”
Reviews.Author: CCO_10
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my daughter for some shopping. Best features : Very clean, well appointed rooms, everything new, friendly staff. Several nice cafes right next door and grocery store and pharmacy across the street. Fridge and microwave added bonus. Best thing I liked was the quiet - someone was smart enough to add design features to minimize noise - ice machines are in a separate room, doors do not slam, modified layout (no long corridors). Things that weren't particularly as issue but good to know about - the outdoor patio deck is very small. Maybe 7 or 8 chairs at best and for a good part of the day the deck is shaded. It's about a 10 minute walk to the main shopping area of St.Catherine St. Overall, very good value and good choice for parent and child (quiet, and felt secure there).

Reviews.Title: “A nice property, but nothing outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Ottawan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights at the beginning of our 2 week holiday, We are ex-Montrealers and stayed at the hotel while we were vising family before undertaking our trip to Quebec's Gaspe Coast. The hotel is your average business-oriented hotel in the centre of Montreal. It is well situated. The room was clean and well lit; the TV modern, the beds comfortable, the staff nice. Being ex-Montrealers, we did not need any help with getting around the city. And we only used the room, not any of the other facilities in the hotel. My interaction with staff was minimal. My only complaint was the high cost of parking and the parking garage which I found to be very cramped. The garage has concrete posts everywhere and one must be very careful otherwise your car will be damaged.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Parking is a horror.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler444
Reviews.Content: We had to park 6 floors below ground in a dark, smelly area that didn't seem safe. Everything else was great. No Car? Then this is hotel is for you. Need to Park? Then, take your $22 a day and look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Will L
Reviews.Content: I travel to Montreal about five times a year for business, and after staying in a bunch of different hotels over the last few years, I've settled on this as my favourite. It's a touch pricey but overall it's worth it. The rooms are clean and well decorated, food in the restaurant and room service is very good, and the staff are very friendly. The exercise room, sauna, swimming pool and hot tub are really nice. Location is great; you can easily walk to downtown shopping and restaurants, a quick walk to the metro, and a cheap cab ride anywhere downtown. The underground parking is bright, clean, and easy to access. In short, a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good standard business hotel, but nothig exceptional”
Reviews.Author: remobor1
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights there with my wife in her business trip. Ths Hotel was compliant to its claimed standard and quality, but it lacked a little of personality. The weak point was the breakfast, not really what we were expecting for that type of hotel. Other than that, room was very good, we had wifi access, and the swimming pool on the top of the building was pleasant. Overall, I would suggest this hotel if you are willing to spend $180+ per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for downtown Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: ironleague
Reviews.Content: Second time staying here. It is becoming our favourite place to stay in Montreal. Friendly Check-In staff, great location, immaculately clean rooms. We checked thoroughly for bed bugs and found no trace of them, which is great for a big city. Nice pool and rooftop deck. My only negatives are expensive parking, the shower leaked (I felt bad for the housekeeper as the floor mat was soaked), and I received no newspaper even though I was charged for them. These are minor issues and not going to prevent me from coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Lobby, Avg Rooms, Parking in Dungeon”
Reviews.Author: 1BIGTRAVELGUY
Reviews.Content: There are 2 totally different reviews for this hotel depending whether you are planning to park there or not. If you are coming by bus, please skip the next few negative lines: The garage is deep underground and unattended - I would never allow my wife or daughter to join me down there and certainly not allow them to go by themselves. Sublevel one, two and three are usually full, while sublevels 4 and 5 are reserved for local apartment renters. That leaves sub level 6 that is usually gated - they expect you to exit your car and find the dungeon phone to call the desk and have them send a person down to open the gate. Nothing like getting out of your car in an unattended, garbage- smelling, dungeon to use the wall phone. Then, once you find a spot 6 levels underground, you need to go through a series of poorly marked, poorly lit, doors to find the elevator. And, of course, they charge $22 per day for this awful adventure. Coming by bus? The lobby is great and the rooms are clean and adequate (although we had no view - just the hotel air conditioner.... pretty bad). The mattresses are not bouncy.... we jumped in and it felt like a sand box. It must be a new style because we did sleep ok. The bathrooms were meticulous and the shower was great. Hence, this is a mixed review (the price of $160/night prepaid was fair). I must say that the staff at the Hilton are truly great. Ruebens and Christopher are part of the concierge staff and there's nothing that they wouldn't do for you. Christopher spent a long time explaining how to get from Montreal to Ottawa and was truly a pleasant fellow that had me thinking positively about the Hilton experience. (clean room, no bugs, friendly staff, fair cost...... I guess thats good).

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: The_Gs76
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel room. Friendly staff with a great concierge. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Completely satisified”
Reviews.Author: MimiDot
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the staff, room and the pool. A very nice stay in a great location. They really have the customer in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice staff and very comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: San_Fior
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about Hilton Garden Inn. It is very well located. The staff was friendly and room really comfortable. The only should improve in the future is food options for breakfast. However, the waiters there were really amazing friendly. By the way, we loved the French Canadian people they are awesome !

Reviews.Title: “newer hotel that's very hip”
Reviews.Author: Sammyc
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn last Sept. Awesome hotel. The decor is new, hip and makes me feel like I'm in a W hotel. The rooms are spacious, beds comfortable. It's a bit North of the old town area. I'd say it takes about 20 min to walk (so we drove everywhere). There are restaurants all around the hotel so it's easy to go out and grab something to eat. I'd stay there again when I'm in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: cfried
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed in a nicer Hilton Garden Inn. The rooms were spotless and very stylish, the queen beds were incredibly comfortable, our standard room was very large. I traveled with my two teenage sons, so we asked for a roll away bed for my younger son. It fit in the room no problem, with plenty of space left to use the desk and spread out our suitcases, etc. The rooftop pool and fitness room are gorgeous, the bar/restaurant was elegant, and the staff couldn't have been nicer. The hotel's location was perfect for walking to almost of all of the city's sights.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest, fully renovated, modern decor”
Reviews.Author: LeisureDemon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel because it was close to downtown and had a fridge and microwave, which was, believe it or not, hard to come by even at the Fairmont or Intercontinental, which I considered. I also wanted a pool and gym, which it had. The reviews on Tripadvisor were better than for the other hotels and also the price. The parking was better because it was private. What stood out the most was the cleanliness which was outstanding, the friendliness of the staff, especially the front desk, who go out of their way taking the time to give you a map and directions. I felt safe because of the key entrance for the underground parking, not public parking as you would get at other hotels. The one meal I had from room service was wonderful and prompt. I had no complaints about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: dataman18
Reviews.Content: This is a clean and modern hotel conveniently located right downtown, near the Place des Arts Metro and theatre, and about a 15 minute walk from Mount Royal. The room was large, clean and comfy. We also enjoyed the pool and whirlpool, which were located on the roof, offering great views of the city. There's a large balcony area outside the pool where you can lie in the sun. My only quibble was that the ice machine on our floor didn't work despite repeated calls, although it was over the weekend, so it could be the repairman was not available. The staff were very friendly and helpful in suggesting nearby attractions and restaurants. Other than that, this is a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Excellent Service, Awesome Beds”
Reviews.Author: miko789
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at this hotel for a convention at the Palais de Congress. The location of the hotel is very central. It is a 7-10 minute walk to Palais de Congress and a 12 minute walk to Old Montreal. St. Catherine St. (where shopping is abundant) is a 5 minute walk and there are neighborhood cafes, restaurants and grocery across and adjacent to the hotel. It is near McGill University. ST. Denis and St. Alexander St. is a 7-10 minute walk (where the st. is fille with small boutiques, restaurants). The building is very modern and the rooms are well lit and very clean and modernly designed. The queen beds are heavenly to sleep on. Service is great from the concierge to the reservation people and the cleaners. There is a fitness center and a salt water swimming pool and a jacuzzi. The pool and jacuzzi is very clean and well maintained. Parking is extra but you dont really need a car as everything is walkable and you can easily take a cab. Overall a really good value for this hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for Rooms on 200 floor”
Reviews.Author: andrex_ca
Reviews.Content: We came back early from a home swap and decided to deal with jetlag at a Hilton. We confirmed our reservation two months in advance. When we arrived, we were given a room on the second floor overlooking a roof and a large, noisy, central water cooler and various exhaust vents. I mentioned this to the reception and received shrugged shoulders as a reply. Apparently the hotel was full. That night, we did not sleep well because of the noise from the mechanical unit on the adjacent roof. One would think that with two months notice we might have been given a better room.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying & Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: StakeLover
Reviews.Content: This is by all appearances a well run property. I was impressed with the friendliness of the mobile staff within. It seems that most of the people in this part of Montreal were friendly - Lovely beds as usual (Hilton/Hampton). Our room was spacious. The pool room was nice and exercise room was exceptional. The advertised outdoor sunning patio (11th floor) was a little disappointing because only the morning sun got it and it was a little narrow. The steam rooms were in the bathrooms making them specific. I prefer my to do this with my wife together. Price would be rated a little high priced value wise. There was nothing to complain about but if they were to add a delectable fruit bar to the breakfast would be nice. We came away totally refreshed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent For Getting Around Montreal”
Reviews.Author: drfredJamaicaEstates
Reviews.Content: My girl friend and I enjoyed a long weekend stay at this hotel. It is centrally located and within walking distance of Old Montreal, Cirque du Soleil, street fairs, the waterfront, many museums, restaurants and night clubs. The staff was cordial and very accommodating. Breakfast was a combination of buffet and ala carte. It was very good, with a variety of selections, but a bit pricey at $25. per person. We were somewhat disappointed that the hotel did not have a lounge. A small bar was located in back of the dining area, but it was not very romantic. An indoor swimming pool was located on the top floor , but we did not use it. Similarly we did not use the fitness center. No shuttle service is provided. A taxi ride to and from the airport was $38. each way. A currency exchange was located two doors from the hotel and provided a better exchange than the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in the heart of the business district.”
Reviews.Author: TinySwimmer
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. If you want to be in the tourist district, this is 2 km away and an easy walk down the hill. The rooms were very large with lots of storage. The WiFi worked very well, it has an excellent indoor swimming pool and workout center on the roof with outdoor sun deck. Excellent, though somewhat pricy breakfast. Enjoy it on the terrace and watch the world go by. And a staff that couldn't be more helpful. One annoyance is that the elevators require a key card to go anywhere. This gets bothersome after a while. Self parking in the underground garage is plentiful, but somewhat tight. Just be careful and look before turning corners or backing up. The rooms has mini refridgerators and microwave ovens which were nice to have. The beds were very firm, perhaps just a bit too firm for my taste, but that is a personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best Hilton Garden Inn I have stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Amit_and_Alex
Reviews.Content: Very nice, large and comfortable room. Top floor has a gym that would rival new Asian hotels. Nice and comfortable lobby. Breakfast is nicely done. They take your order for eggs and crepes and bring them to the table. No need to stand in line waiting for eggs to cook. Wi-Fi works throughout. Very close to annual Montreal Jazz Festival, McGill University and Parc Royal. Had a great stay, and will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Awesome Weekend”
Reviews.Author: vicky95
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel early Saturday. The front desk was very helpful and offered to hold our bags until our room was ready. The front desk personel are very friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel is a quick walk to the Metro and we were able to use that to get all around town to visit the botanical garden, Jean Talon Market as well as a number of breweries on St. Denis. Can definitely walk from the hotel to downtown - 10 minutes. The rooms were clean, the beds extremely comfortable. The hotel had a little snack store and the rooms have microwaves, which was great for when we returned back late at night and had the munchies. We did use the pool and it was clean. My only comment regarding the pool is that there is not nearly enough tables / loungers to put your stuff on while you take a dip. The view from the pool area is great since it is on the top floor. We def. plan on going back to Montreal again and would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the centre of montreal”
Reviews.Author: MayaPoliak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for my stagette. This is a good hotel, well maintained, great service, very very clean. The rooms are spacious, well lit and modern. The location is great, close to old town, shopping on st. catherine and close to outremont.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Well-Located Hotel - Loved the Rooftop Deck!”
Reviews.Author: QTPyePop
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn for two nights during my birthday (woohoo!) weekend. Iâ€™m a HHonors member, and I booked the room using HHonors points. The hotel is in a great location. Itâ€™s close to a subway station and within distance of Old Montreal, Chinatown, and much, much more. The hotel is very modern and is kept extremely clean. The room has a small refrigerator and microwave for your use. Their pool is located on the top floor and thereâ€™s even an outdoor rooftop deck where you can lounge and enjoy the scenery. In fact, you can see the MontrÃ©al International Fireworks Competition from the rooftop deck. Itâ€™s not as good as being at La Ronde or at the Jacques-Cartier Bridge, for example, but if you donâ€™t feel up to leaving the hotel â€“ itâ€™s perfect. All of the staff were great throughout my stay. The breakfast was absolutely wonderful! There were cold selections as well as cooked to order items such as crepes, waffles, eggs, hashbrowns, sausage, and bacon. I would definitely stay at this hotel if Iâ€™m in Montreal again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and friendly hotel in the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: JerseyJoeMo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night this past weekend and were very pleased with the hotel. I got a room last minute using my Hilton Honors points. The bottom line is that I have stayed in plenty of Hiltons all over the world and a few Garden Inns and this Garden Inn was on par or better than any Hilton I have ever stayed. For starters, we arrived at noon on Saturday, hoping for an early check-in. To our surprise, a room was ready for us. It happened to be a corner room on the 3rd floor. The room was huge, probably the biggest hotel room I have ever stayed in, including suites. I estimate it was 400 square feet. What a great surprise! The room itself was well appointed, immaculately clean, and well organized. The hotel overall was very nice, probably somewhat new, impeccably clean, and inviting. The staff were probably the best part. The concierge worked with us to make several dining recommendations, even calling around on a Saturday night when we were kind of desperate to get into a good restaurant. He was really top notch. When we checked out at noon the next day, they were kind enough to store our bags for us for a few hours while we wandered around downtown. We didn't use any of the hotel services, such as the pool, gym, restaurant, or bar, but we did walk around and check everything out, and it all looked great, especially the pool and the gym. The location is very central and you can walk to anywhere, including the Place de Arts, Old Montreal, Le Main, etc. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfort”
Reviews.Author: ejrace
Reviews.Content: This hotel had quite a good location, near the metro station and about 20 minutes to walk to old town. The room we had was really comfortable, though as the hotel is on the first 11 floors, was quite low down, so no view - except of other roofs (and noisy aircon units - I needed earplugs). There were all the comforts of a hilton garden inn room you would expect, including choice of pillows. King size beds and baths are a combination not available in this hotel, as all king bedded rooms have showers, which for us was a little disappointing. The pool area was lovely with a terrace for sitting out on and a hot tub, and huge fitness area was available too - though don't forget your pool towel from your room, as none are provided on this floor. Easy check out, though with only one luggage cart you may have to queue to get use of it.

Reviews.Title: “Still disappointing customer service”
Reviews.Author: wbabronco
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well placed near Rue Catherine. The rooms were spacious and tidy and the restaurant downstairs did an excellent breakfast buffet. However, I had two issues with the safety deposit and not getting a wake up call which was critical as we nearly missed a vital connection. When I raised this at the front desk I was told to email the manager for which I did the same day. As yet nearly 2 and half weeks on I've had no response and 7 days ago I emailed Hilton customer service and still haven't heard. Totally spoiled my experience with this organization.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GinLemonade
Reviews.Content: Awesome bed, very comfit. Really firm and clean sheets everyday. The view was ok, but we were not there for it. I didn't visit the pool, but apparently it's amazing. Staffs were great and very helpful. Near the nice action in downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pool, and the friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JMtl
Reviews.Content: We're locals, but wanted to have a little getaway. This hotel didn't disappoint. The best feature for me was the pool area, which is on the roof (10th floor I think). There is a nice view of Montreal from there, and you can sit outside and just soak it all in. The gym facilities are extensive, and there is a steam room. The room decor was fine - the bathroom was actually pretty nice (granite, glass shower, etc). The staff was extremely friendly and polite, which is always a nice touch. And as a Montrealer, I can tell you the location is very good. From there, you can walk to the old port,Ste-Catherine St., the plateau, St-Laurent, St-Denis, etc. It's a safe area.

Reviews.Title: “nice clean and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: chaletswiss
Reviews.Content: was pleasantly surprised with the friendliness and helpfullness of the hotel, speaking only english was no problem. room had 2 queen beds for 4 adults and was quite spacious.beds were very comfortable. shower was great. overall the hotel as very clean. no complaints...however since we were celebrating 2 birthdays I wish they would have made the effort to perhaps put a flower in our room, just sometihng to make us feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: svpuffin
Reviews.Content: We stay at a lot of Hilton Garden Inn Hotels and this was one of the best. Great downtown location near McGill and has great access to the subway. You can walk to Plateau Mont Royal and its great restaurants. Staff was very friendly and the bar had an outdoor seating area which was nice in the spring weather

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: cruisebreeze
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last month on a week's vacation. Found the hotel to be in a nice location whereby we can easily access via subway, buses, walking to most places such as St Laurent, old montreal, downtown montreal. Very happy with this factor. Service-wise the hotel staffs were all very nice, friendly and helpful (giving tips on how to get to places within montreal). They have free internet service in your room as well as computer for use in their business centre with printing facilities (all complimentary). Room is clean and large. Has microwave and a mini fridge in the room. Hotel is also not far from the airport. Taxi fare costs less than CAD30. Getting to the train station is also nearby.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: dmacleod11
Reviews.Content: Couple days pleasure trip for some R&R with my spouse. No issues with my stay. Hotel and people were very nice. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie_d6
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! The staff are very nice and helpfull in every way possible. The location is great, nothing better than to be downtown montreal! I would go back anytime and have already suggested this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: senecal_deborah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel memorial day weekend with a few friends we had a great time. the hotel was very clean, staff was friendly and helpful. I would stay here again and would recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room - A Bit Pricey”
Reviews.Author: greygypsy
Reviews.Content: We flew into Montreal to attend a wedding in Burlington, Vermont (about 1 1/2 hours away). Unfortunately, our luggage didn't make it, and the exit off the highway to get to this hotel was closed. Thankfully, a nice front desk person gave me personal directions to get to the hotel. The room we had was very large and tastefully decorated. The front desk was as helpful as they could be in a lost luggage situation, but they would not give us some basic toiletries (we would have to pay) which every other Hilton I have stayed at would be happy to do. The parking is expensive - $22 CAN per night, and the hotel taxes plus the basic rate made the hotel rather expensive - even for Montreal. Our breakfast was included, but if not it was also a rather pricey $16 per person. Next time we are in Montreal, unless we can get a bargain here, we will probably stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but nothing special would choose a different hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: leijsw
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Montreal, and it was really wonderful. We plan to visit Montreal again, and next time we would probably stay in a different location. This facility is truly downtown. The hotel is very busy, and the service quick and efficient, but a little brusque. The concierge (a young man at the door) was lovely. The breakfast buffet was very nice, and the pool and spa areas extremely nice. It's just that it was a little pricey, and I felt like we were staying in a downtown nice motel type experience, even though it's certainly a high rise. We are Hilton Gold members, and I was a little disappointed at our inner view, but in fairness, I did not complain. I didn't feel that complaints would be welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice addition to Montreal hotel scene”
Reviews.Author: tjrutledge
Reviews.Content: A Hilton is a Hilton, and in this case that's just fine. Even at some of the chains, hotel rooms in Montreal can be dicey. But this is a nice addition to downtown Montreal. The rooms are spacious, clean, bright and simple. Outstanding breakfast, free and speedy WiFi, a great pool and work out room, and a super convenient location within walking distance of St Laurent and downtown, with the metro only two blocks away. Overall this is a great hotel and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Ranjana2011
Reviews.Content: What horrifies me is that the pool has either sharp edges or glass in it. My son went in for a swim and came out with a deep cut on this toe! Considering suing the hotel Was very disappointed with room service too. Exorbitant prices and very meager servings. Except for the location and the helpful staff, nothing much of worth here

Reviews.Title: “exceeded customer service standards”
Reviews.Author: Kanuckster
Reviews.Content: Been to a lot of major centers in North America and this hotel had by far the best customer service exerience across the board in all catagories. Rooms were great, food was great and the hotel is central to pretty much anything you want to see or do. $7 taxi ride to old Montreal:) The staff have a customer centric attitude which came across as genuine. Underground mall 3 blocks away goes on for miles. Old churches on almost every block. Unexpected great experreince in hotel and Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and room for the price”
Reviews.Author: vacationdealqueen
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great centralized location in downtown Montreal. You can walk to shopping on st. catherine and a couple good museums: redpath and museum of fine arts and take a cheap cab ride to Old Montreal. Service was great; the concierge made several dinner reservations for us at my request and offered helpful advice. The building is also one of tallest in Montreal so you can see it from many points in the city (this was helpful to us at the end of our nights as we navigated with a rental car). The only downside were the bedsheets were not the best; they were more like hospital sheets - weren't very soft and had probably had low thread count. Other than that the room seemed recently upgraded and modern. You have to pay extra for parking but internet is free. Boutique hotels scare me and I think this probably had a better location than the W and obviously cheaper, so I would recommend this hotel. If I visit Montreal again, I will probably try to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nicely located, good value.”
Reviews.Author: JennP1
Reviews.Content: We had never been to this hotel before this weekend, and we do not regret our choice at all! The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, the room we got was huge and nice, the bed was confortable and there was enough parking underground. And, most of all, the price was not prohibitive! Definitely, we will come back nex time we are in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nothing too neg or pos.”
Reviews.Author: RR_USA
Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly staff Cons: Socalled "high speed" internet needs to be upgraded; room service food could be tastier. Verdict: Good hotel: nothing exceptionally negative, but also nothing exceptionally positive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: luvs2trvl7
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying here a few days back for a long weekend. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to Old Montreal and to Mont Royal, if weather is good :) We walked up Rue St. Denis one night (which is very close to the hotel) and were amazed by the restaurants and bars on the street. Had drinks and dessert at Papa's Tapas. It was overpriced and ok. Had dinner at Juliet and Chocolat. It is a must visit for dessert lovers! Had breakfast at Eggspectation, great place, big menu, awesome food! Had crepes at Crepes 2 go (right next to hotel) and was really good! The only issue is its open from 9-2pm only. Had Poutine at La Banquise in Old Montreal. The place came highly recommended and didn't disappoint at all. They had 25 different varieties of Poutine. I can't look at another plate of fries after that! Overall, Montreal is an awesome place to visit. We just picked a bad couple of days to be there. We had one good sunny, cold day, the other days were rainy, with some sleet. But we still had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Best Breakfast Buffet We've Ever Had”
Reviews.Author: icecream16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here April 7,8,9 &10. I chose this hotel over Embassy Suites because of the pool. We never ended up swimming but my husband did use the jacuzzi and said it was wonderful. Prior reviews said the pool was small but I thought it was a nice size. Based on prior reviews I was expecting a kiddie pool but I thought it was very nice. The buffet was included in our pirce and was the BEST I've ever been to. One suggestion for the crepes, try something other than chocolate with strawberries every day. I think I saw bananas with nutella somewhere. Anyway, the room was nice. Standard size. Nice view. Two others suggestions. When we arrived, we asked the front desk about local things to do and they directed us to the concierge who was very helpful but it wasn't until the last day that I discovered a rack of brochures hidden around the corner of the front desk near the office meeting rooms while on my way to their computer room to print our boarding passes for the trip home. You can print them from their wifi from your room but that system was temporarily down. Odd that the brochures wouldn't be prominently displayed or that the front desk would not make us aware of them either. They should. Lastly, this happens at all hotels, but it would be nice if you are booking a room for three people to have toiletries for three people in the room when you arrive instead of having to call housekeeping for extras. I had no problems with my bill regarding parking fees like others wrote. I would stay here again if I knew I was going to use the pool and if I were coming in better weather. I will stay at the Embassy Suites if I decide I want a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “very clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: endingstart
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel. I stayed here for one night and was pleased with it this time around too. Good staff who were welcoming and helpful but not in your face, which is good. Rooms seem very big and have a microwave and pretty decent sized fridge which is a good bonus. Beds are also great and i love that you can adjust them. The location is pretty good. Close enough to shopping, food and a subway station although at night the hill you have to walk up is kind of tiring and a bit deserted. Overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience overall with a couple mistakes handled well”
Reviews.Author: Lockz
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights and just got home. I am a Silver member of HHonours, and had stayed at this hotel once before for one night. When I arrived as soon as I mentioned my name they had my check-in information there waiting for me. They gave me the choice of a room higher up facing the back (my preference as indicated online) or lower down facing the front. I took the higher-up room, although it was right beside the elevator which I don't like (also indicated in my preferences). Good clean room, wider than usual as I think I got an accessible room, so that was appreciated once I realized it. Although I was right beside the elevators I barely heard a thing from them, good job there. The one thing I can say bad about the room is something that others have noted; there is only a shower, no bath or combination unlike the Embassy Suites in Montreal which I've also stayed in. Microwave and empty bar fridge in the room, decent flatscreen TV but no HD channels and not much channel selection compared to other places I've stayed at. Although the pouch with the keys says a Globe & Mail will be delivered to my room and I can decline this and get some money back at my stay, no papers were delivered to my room or any other. I asked about it the second day and was given a paper by the front desk; the second day I was able to get one by the elevator (a pile of them and Le Devoir sitting there for everyone); sounds like one could just decline the papers then ask as no one would know. It unexpectedly rained my last full day there; I came equipped for snow. The front desk was fantastic and had umbrellas available for a $40 deposit, which they charged to the room. Good big umbrella, and this was a great service. However, they neglected to record that I dropped it off so it was showing on the bill plus taxes when they slipped it under my door. This was rectified when I brought it up with the front desk. I had the rate that included breakfast; they included three breakfast coupons in the key pouch with an indicated value of $16.95 each. Good food; choices of omelettes and eggs made to order, pancakes, french toast, crepe of the day, and sides of meat. Juices, Starbucks coffee, cold cuts, breads, etc. were also available.

Reviews.Title: “A warm, inviting haven for a cold Canadian weekend!”
Reviews.Author: CoralExplorer
