Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hilton Garden Inn - Centerville in Quebec could not have been better. Starting with location - a metro station is a block away around the corner. We arrived, parked our car in the underground garage (there is a fee for this) and used the metro throughout our stay. The reception staff were very gracious and efficient. Our room was very nice. The view was not spectacular - but it was inconsequential to me really. 2 queen beds with comfy mattresses and warm duvets. A big plasma TV, wireless internet and a spacious clean bathroom. The room was always toasty warm - which I appreciated as the weekend we went to Montreal was really cold out. I slept well every night. Breakfast was included with my room - and was excellent as well. In addition to a nice buffet - they offered cooked-to-order eggs, pancakes and french toast. Nice waitresses bring coffee and keep your cup full. There is a indoor pool, a large spa and gym on a top floor and offered a nice view of the city. All in all - a great stay and I would definitely book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business travel”
Reviews.Author: MikeInThornhill
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hilton Garden Inn on Tue 2/22 on a quick business trip. It is in a great location, just minutes from all kinds of restaurants and the bustle of downtown. Check in was quick and smooth, the room was newly renovated with flat screen tv, digital cable, granite countertops, and a big comfortable king sized bed. The room was also equipped with an empty mini fridge and microwave that I didn't use. Wireless internet was included. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: infopro
Reviews.Content: We were able to check in early and our room was spotlessly clean. Strong, free WiFi, easy walking distance to shopping on St. Catherines (5 mins), Starbucks coffee, a microwave and fridge round out the offerings at this hotel. The bed was very comfortable, with a note that indicated that even the decorative pillow cover was laundered for every guest - a nice reassurance as I always wonder about these pillows and usually have to stash them in a far corner of the room. The pool was also very clean, not too cold, and the hot tub was the perfect temperature. The hotel provides pool towels in each guest room so there are no piles of dirty towels in the pool area. Great idea. Security is better than in most hotels as guests need a room key card to operate the elevator. Just remember to bring it with you every time you leave your room... Underground parking was reasonable for downtown ($21) and the garage is spacious. Staff were friendly and capable throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality / value”
Reviews.Author: pauljames403
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel on a business trip. Usual Hilton standards. Profesional, efficient check in. Room was ready and clean. Room is a good size with flat screen and work area. Internet was quick and easy to access, worked well for my stay. Hotel has an on site restaurent, good size indoor pool, whirlpool, and work out area. Location is in downtown Montreal, about a block or so from some fairly major shopping, dinning, and entertainment. The major shopping and entertainment areas are probably a 10 min cab ride away although walkable in good/warm weather. I paid $10 to cab to "Old Montreal" which is a tourist spot. Paid about $160 with all taxes which is about right for decent accomodation in downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Feneant
Reviews.Content: We stayed there a few nights after switching from a hotel that had no pool. We ended up not using it but did go check it out, rather small but it looks nice and has a jacuzzi next to it. Seemed to be in use pretty consistently during our trip. The rate was a very affordable 155$ for a suite per night. The room was bigger than some (though not overly large for a suite) with a separate dining/meeting area. It was well maintained and very clean but I don't understand why hotels persist in those stand up showers with doors that leak all over the place. Our floor was wet every morning after we showered because the door did not close well and wasn't flush on the bottom so water could flow out. A minor complaint but it's the same in many hotels I stay. My only actual complaint is that the bed had to be the most uncomfortable I've ever slept in. Even with the mattress where you could change the stiffness we woke up with back pain every morning. The pillows were also enormous and fluffy making for an uncomfortable night's sleep. The location is good, not the greatest as you are a few streets up from everything but it's Montreal so you know there is a metro station within a 5 minute walk. Actually, in the summer it would probably be just fine but in the winter you need to contend with wet sidewalks, puddles, rude drivers who splash you, etc. The city does a terrible job on the snow removal so we had wet feet the entire time.

Reviews.Title: “Simply awesome”
Reviews.Author: sallan71
Reviews.Content: Not a lot can be said. New, crisp, clean, convenient. Incredible hotel with everything you could want of the highest quality

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable with attentive and prompt service”
Reviews.Author: jt12321
Reviews.Content: I've traveled to Montreal for work about ten times in the past few years and stayed at several hotels. While all have been very good, I have been consistently happy with this facility due to the reasonable rates and 1st class service. Disclosure: I am a Marriott Rewards silver and Hilton HHonors Diamond member and typically chose places where I can get points. Although downtown Montreal is dotted with several facilities from both chains, this HGI facility is a few blocks walking from downtown (centre-ville). Between price, service, quality of accommodations and location, it really is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic visit.”
Reviews.Author: Underhill_VTfromVT
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy, I asked for and was placed in a tenth floor room. The parking garage access with the room key is brilliant. In NYC or Boston, once you park you cannot come and go w/out accruing more charges ! The helpful front desk exchanged American Money for Canadian with no problem..... they will change up to $100. Rue Sherbrooke had frequent buses and was just blocks away from chinatown and the Latin Quarter for walking/ shopping/ dining. All the concierges were quick with maps and well informed. Cute guys ! We appreciated the free internet usage to research shops, print out maps, be in touch with family back home. If we'd brought our own laptops, we'd have gotten lost in them, and it would be like being at home !!! The top floor pool has a breathtaking view. We were lucky to have two sunny days out of a three day stay.... We showered side by side before and after swimming overlooking the city. At one point we just held hands while showering. The outdoor patio in summer must be fun. There is a nice sofa and chairs on one level below the pool. someone was there. So I turned the lounge chairs to face the city instead of the pool and we watched pigeons swirl about, in and out of streets below. What fun. There are also saunas in the women's and mens' changing areas. Sauna and spa pool were working well and quiet. Very relaxing. The room was crisp, clean. ...comfy beds ... quiet...we slept like rocks. Hotel lobby has a cozy gas fireplace, sofas .... and restaurant service, food and atmosphere were great. Leisurely breakfast is such a luxury these days, with Starbucks coffee no less! Loved the rocks on the room divider between bar and restaurant. Came home and moved some of my beach rocks to the dining room table! The silk flower arrangements with stones in transparent oblong containers were soothing....Wall art work was very interesting !!! So all and all, we had the excitement of great museums, good food and shopping choices, AND a quiet oasis to come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Can't trust them”
Reviews.Author: kerinaottawa
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night and unfortunately I left something at in my room.I called as soon as I realized (about 5 hours after I checked out) and they did not find it. I know it is my responsibility to pack my own belongings but in the case where you may forget something, a guest should feel secure that hotel staff will do their job and submit the lost items to lost & found. Not so at this hotel. The item was left on the bathroom counter, an obvious place so there is no reason for it not to have been passed in. I cannot trust this place anymore, will never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great time! Service, staff and security”
Reviews.Author: wentonatrip99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week around New Years with my fiance and some friends. Most of the other reviews said that this Hilton was in a great location and was a great hotel - boy, were they right!! This place was definitely worth every penny. The gentleman who checked me in was very nice and really took the time to explain to me all of the hotel's services and amenities. I certainly love a great check-in experience! The restaurant was also really great. The staff were very nice and they had some very interesting items on the menu. The meals I had there were top-notch. The room was nice and spacious, all that we needed to have - bathrobes, coffee maker, microwave, TV, free wireless internet... And their little store in the lobby had all the goodies we needed when we weren't out adventuring around town. Everything you could want to do is within a small walk, metro or bus ride. Movies, concerts, restaurants, shopping, bars, clubs and even museums. I had a great time in Montreal. On top of all this, we were there for New Years and were worried that we were going to have to listen to all-night parties in a room next to ours. Were we ever impressed by the security tactics enforced by the management! As it was, we found the hotel very safe (key card needed to access the floors and garage) - in the rooms and in the garage - but they sure pulled all the tricks out of their sleeves that night. There was plenty of security and they were checking everyone that came into the hotel - making sure that they were guests and that there weren't many people going up to each room. It was very comforting that there were a couple of police officers there as well making sure that no one would come in and cause problems. This was especially nice in contrast to the Holiday Inn next door, where people standing outside were inviting people off the street to come in and party in their rooms with them. Overall this was a great trip and this hotel, staff and their management definitely helped make it that way!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!, really nice Pool!”
Reviews.Author: VjackV
Reviews.Content: I came to the Hilton garden Inn with my girlfriend for a weekend away from my roommates. We had a great time, We chose this hotel from all the positive reviews here on trip advisor. There are so many choices in MontrÃ©al and this one is a must. We got a King size bed that was a bit firm, but we found out from the front desk that all the mattresses are adjustable so we were able to change the softness of the bed. And had no issues there. Seeing is how it get so cold sometimes here we were very excited to use the indoor pool. Heated and clean. The only thing is we found out that it is shared with the apartments next door, which is less of an issue with pool but we noticed the gym was very busy at certain times. We went to see the front desk for some suggestions for diner. We stayed away from the hotel restaurant because we wanted something fancier, and with a bit more choice. The girl at the front desk was very nice, but she kept trying to give us a map. We told her we lived here and just wanted to try something we may not have heard of. She then Directed us to the concierge. Not so much fun to get passed around from person to person, but they were always nice about it. The gentleman who was working at the door was also the concierge he suggested us to go to Vertige which was a very nice French restaurant in the Plateau of the city. Nothing new food wise for us but good either way. When we finally got to bed we noticed a bit of noise from outside we were facing Sherbrook street). There was a little bit of noise, but that is to be expected when staying in the city. The next morning we passed by to inquire about the taxes on our bill. We didnâ€™t know there was a hospitality taxe on top of all the other taxes in quebec. We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant on the way out. My girlfriend and I go out for breakfast quite often, it was nice to have a buffet breakfast for only 15$ comes with eggs, sausage, fruit, coffee, and a bunch of other stufff we didnt want. Compaired to most breakfast the price was compairable and seeing any other a la carte breakfast would cost the same price for the same or even less, it was worth it we figured. In the end we had a good time. It was an affordable hotel, that was good enough for us!

Reviews.Title: “Basic amenities, adequate rooms, but poor service”
Reviews.Author: astorio
Reviews.Content: I was encouraged after reading reviews, so decided against the usual Sofitel down the street where I always stay in favor of a jaunt at the Hilton GI. Upon check-in, despite requesting high floor was placed on lower floor. Spouse realized this and I immediately asked for higher floor, but the desk clerk *rolls eyes*, and says the only higher one, two floors up actually has a worse view. I speak French, but thought perhaps his attitude was because I addressed him in English. Ok, I thought, so we went with it. The room overlooks a busy street, but noise wasn't that bad. Oh well, we didn't have the highest room rate, I justify to myself. Indoor garage parking is about $25 per day after taxes/fees, which was reasonable and very secure. No complaints there. Free wifi was slow but a nice perk. Restaurant in lobby was very pricey for middle of the road quality food; we ended up eating one meal there but went back for two at the Sofitel (they have a truly outstanding menu.) Rooms are adequate -- look at the pics here and you will get a good idea of what to expect. Dingy old dirty carpet that I wouldn't walk barefoot, but otherwise pretty clean and well maintained. Towels aging and thin, but comforter laundered (big plus) and sheets very clean. No robes or other amenities of significance. I would have given this a significantly better review except for my experience at check out at the end of our 4 day stay. A short time prior to our checkout time, my spouse became quite ill, and around 11 AM she calls the desk and asks for a few more minutes to checkout (I'm a Hilton honors member.) Check out is normally at noon. A different desk clerk again gives her attitude, and says "That is not a feature of Hilton honors... it is our discretion, and you can only have until 12:30." I had all the bags packed, standing by the door in a suit and tie, waiting for my spouse to exit the bathroom, and at 12:25 there is a knock on the door by a woman with a clipboard, asking "what time are you going to leave? Your time is up and need to be out." I pleaded with her that my wife was a tad ill, and she said "Fine" and left. ??? We were out of the room less than 10 minutes later, at 12:35. I've never really been treated like this as a frequent business traveler -- I'm not sure if it was because I made the reservation on Expedia? Or if they get a lot of "squatters?" I checked availability of the hotel and it was wide open, so they were not pressed for turnover. The woman was not a room-cleaner, she was just bouncing us out. Two weeks later, and the hotel has still not credited my Hilton Honors account despite writing it on Expedia reservation form and giving it to the desk clerk. If you stay here - go in with the mindset of a Holiday Inn, not a real Hilton or even Doubletree. It is adequate, but poor, surly service by staff with a poor attitude ruins the stay. We're obviously two professionals after a four day stay and left the room immaculately clean, but they can't give an extra 30 minutes? For shame. I won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Another very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: jocko13
Reviews.Content: As ex Montreal-ers,we usually return for a specific reason(Wedding ,Funeral,etc). This time we wanted to be tourists and get re-acquainted with the city. We chose the HGI again . because of our past positive stays. We were well received at check-in, and were in our rooms in minutes. The lobby is welcoming, and our room was tastefully decorated. Location of this Hilton is great, near the shopping district of Ste Catherine St , near the subway and within walking distance of Old Montreal & Museums. I also like the idea of self underground parking ,as you don't have to wait for valet parking to fetch your vehicle. The staff was pleasant and really made the effort to make us comfortable. On our next return to Montreal ,this hotel will be our home away from home. Congratulations to the management & staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but expensive”
Reviews.Author: godbolem
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in downtown montreal but slightly expensive. It is close to underground city (only couple of blocks) and host of restaurants. The in house rooftop gym and swimming pool is quite nice. Only complaint being that I had to pay 17$ for breakfast after paying 140$ for room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Great Hotel! Will come again!”
Reviews.Author: petzy1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the weekend in December 2010 while coming to Montreal to celebrate our anniversary. The hotel is in a great location ! Near great shopping and restaurants and most importantly Tim Hortons (lol). 2 minute walk to the Metro which takes you all over Montreal fabulously easy and fast! The hotel was spotless and staff was friendly. View of Montreal wasw nice from our room and the room was spacious and the bed soooo comfortable. Overall it was a great stay - we were not at the hotel much but when we were it was great. One added touch was the Neutrogena products in the bathroom, nice big shower and salon style hairdryer. Would stay here again anyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and big comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: merlinslap
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and continue to enjoy the Hilton Garden Inn, located in the Plateau de Mont Royal area. Though close to major restaurants, La Place des Arts and its metro station, shopping, and entertainment, it is also a relatively quiet area compared to other sections of the city. Since I use the hotel mostly for sleeping, I find this makes it very attractive. The rooms are spacious, well appointed, and comfortable. This is not a glamorous, trendy place; just a great well-managed hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and at a good value”
Reviews.Author: kewlfancycat
Reviews.Content: We've always stayed at the Hilton, not only because of the quality of the room and service that we've gotten, but most importantly the entire staff have always gone out of their way to accommodate us. This to me is an IMPECCABLE SERVICE !!! a service that is becoming harder to find.

Reviews.Title: “In short I feel almost like each time at home !”
Reviews.Author: boutetd
Reviews.Content: Am a regular at the hotel to get there on a regular basis. love this place for its warm welcome, dedicated and friendly, the rooms spacious and clean s with wireless internet access and comfortable work area are important assets. Like the fenestrated pool overlooking the city and the exercise room for the periods of relaxation! In short I feel almost like each time at home, I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “3 tips”
Reviews.Author: narkolog
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel with excellent location, new and clean. 3 tips: Bring a beach slippers for the pool (a bathrobe in the number given, and no shoes and very funny look at people in an elevator in the bath robes and winter shoes for bare feet), the sensor in the sauna, cover with a wet towel and get a real steam and make sure Visit the nearby house of jazz

Reviews.Title: “Glad to be back!”
Reviews.Author: Lavant
Reviews.Content: Returned to Montreal for business and to this hotel. Once again I was not disappointed! Due to a very rainy morning, I decided to have breakfast at the hotel. The food is better than usual hotel restaurant fare, and you can have your eggs made to order even if your are having the buffet breakfast, so you are not limited to a heap of scrambled eggs sitting in a vat beneath a heat lamp. Nice touch! I also noticed how efficient the staff is and extremely helpful and friendly but not overbearing or superficial. One day I waited for the elevator so that I could get my car out of the parking and one of the staff was also waiting. When the door opened, she held the elevator button and let me in first. Very subtle but beats the places where employees ignore the guest (been there!).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel & perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: vanna747
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about our stay here. We are a thirty year old couple, and we wanted to be downtown within walking distance of things to do. The location is great, right near the entertainment district, within walking distance of the old port and lots of shopping, restaurants, and other attractions. The hotel itself was very nice, everything looked clean and new. The pool, gym and hot tub on the top floor was fantastic, with a view of the city. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. There was wireless internet, magazines with info on things to see and do, and the room service food was yummy. We also had the breakfast buffet in the restaurant one day, it included a huge selection of different foods for under $15, plus a daily special, also included (on the day we went it was a strawberry chocolate crepe). I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants quality for a good price. Fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay, off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Millcaro
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn was a good find. I got sick for a few days of our trip and was so bummed to miss site-seeing, but if I had to be anywhere, it was nice to be curled up in the quiet, big, soft bed that the Hilton offered. The room was nicely designed. The exercise room was one of the best equipped I've seen in recent travels (tho the business center was the opposite.) Bedding was comfortable. The neighborhood isn't the one I'd have chosen now that I know Montreal a little better - it doesn't have as much character as the nearby Plateau, for example. (Nearby, though, is Benelux - which is a wonderful brewpub. The concierge lead us to a chain restaurant instead, but we figured it out.) But it's near McGill and museums. Nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Hilton - and it's what you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: johnmcga
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in October. We picked it because it had good ratings and fit our price range; usually we prefer to head for smaller hotels, but we left it late and this was the best option given what we wanted to spend. In all, we were impressed. Sure, it's a big hotel, but the front desk service was excellent at check-in and although the room was a little anonymous, it was spacious, had a really comfy bed, decent shower, and even a bit of a view. We didn't have much contact with the staff after check-in, but they were always friendly, polite and very helpful. The location is also excellent - there are plenty of places to eat and drink within walking distance, and it's close to a subway stop if you're venturing further afield. There's a Provigo supermarket over the road too. We didn't try out the bar or restaurant, but did head up to the pool. It felt like a bit of a token effort - three kicks and you've done a length - but at least it was quiet and the view from the 11th floor was decent. We only had one problem during our stay, and that was at checkout. Our bill was incorrect - we'd paid in advance through Opodo, yet our final bill at the hotel included charges for the room and four nights of parking, even though we'd only parked a car for one night. After a brief discussion at checkout, the front desk staff (who were, again, very helpful and polite) admitted the mistake and resolved the problem - yet on arriving home we discovered the credit card had been charged the full amount shown on the incorrect bill, and then refunded. We were surprised the card was charged before we'd ok'd the charges at checkout, and the refund left us out of pocket due to the exchange rate difference. In fairness, we emailed Hilton to complain once we got home and noticed the problem - they've promised to make up the difference - but they should not have charged our credit card before we had ok'd the bill in the first place. Still, that issue aside, we were very happy. Yes, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Scott408
Reviews.Content: Disclosure - I am a Hilton Honors member. I find in general the Hilton Garden hotels are good value for money and this one is no exception. Very friendly welcome and I was quickly in a very spacious and spotless room. Very comfortable bed, excellent working area with wireless and cable internet, and a superb Hermann Miller chair. The following morning breakfast service was excellent. The evening menu is a little limited. Fine if you are tired and can't be bothered to walk just down the hill towards the centre of Montreal, but probably not the place to entertain a customer. On the second morning there was some confusion about my omletter order, but when the waitress brought the check she had removed the omlette cost on the basis that the level of service I had experienced was not to the standard they wanted to offer. Location is good. You could walk to the Central Station or to the 747 Express Bus Stop to the airport in 10-15 minutes. I did not have time to explore the pool or gym facilities I'm going back to Montreal fairly often over the next few months and I have no intention of looking at any other hotels

Reviews.Title: “How suite it was!”
Reviews.Author: VesperGirl
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights at this hotel (Oct 22-29th). I arrived a bit earlier than check in time, but after two hours I was given a room/suite. The space in the room was good. The small kitchen area in the 1BR suite was functional - though I would have put a couch/recliner in that area, instead of a large dining table for 4 (the bed was a king, so max 2 ppl to eat at the table); perhaps a smaller table and a nice couch. The room was clean and quiet. The shower was good - the plastic base left a lot to be desired and the grout could use a bit of bleach, but ciest la vie. The location was good. Everything within walking distance - I would say 25 minute or less to get to either old or 'modern' Montreal attractions. Grocery store was close by for water etc. I did not dine at the restaurant - too many other/cheaper choices around. No major complaints; I did not interact with the staff much, had my own agenda for my visit. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and would return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: fosterschica
Reviews.Content: we just returned from our weekend in montreal, the first time we have ever visited...the hotel was immaculate, the rooms were spotless, updated, and roomyThe beds and pillows were amazing!. WE were within walking distance to pretty much everything. I found the front desk staff not to be the friendliest, however, the concierge was unbeleivably friendly and helpful(these guys kno their city!) My only real complaint was the food at the hotel...it wasnt the tastiest, and wasnt good value for the money, i would suggest eating at one of the many restaurants outside of the hotel. Les 3 Brasseurs in old montreal was terrific! Alot of mixed crowd, university kids, singles and families alike. The hotel is very well maintained and in would recommend to anyone with kids or even business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice, quiet”
Reviews.Author: AresAvatar
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend here as the end of a 10 day vacation split between Vermont and Canada. The room was clean and spacious. Water pressure in the shower was good. The beds were extremely comfortable. We got a good sleep here -- it was quiet. The views were reasonably nice, especially from the pool/hot tub on the 11th floor. They have an outdoor sitting area up there too. Parking is a bit extra, but your room key allows unlimited in/out, unlike some other hotels in the area. The internet service was free with the room but was slow.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: kdubyaNH
Reviews.Content: Very clean room, well appointed. Staff was helpful and friendly. Rooftop pool, spa and fitness center were quite enjoyable. Good location in town.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: Zeph317
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel and their staff. We have some allergies and the hotel had prepared our rooms in advance, to our comfort. The front desk was very polite and professional. The concierge & lobby entrance men were able to advise us on the area, make recommendations, and point us in the right direction. They were very helpful especially with some of our specific needs. We opted for the special rate which included a full made to order breakfast. The food was delicious and plentiful. We appreciated the Starbucks coffee in the room also. We had a nice size room with a view of the street and a cross up on the hill. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. We were within walking distance to everything that we wanted to see. The pool and fitness room were great and we enjoyed an afternoon coffee on the upper deck in the sunshine. The bathroom was spacious with a nice size glass and tile shower. Parking is conveniently located under the hotel with unlimited in and out. There is a fee per day for parking, which is as expected in the city (not liked, but expected). My only complaints was, we had a friend who lives nearby come to visit us at the hotel bar for 2 1/2 hrs. and the hotel charged us the full day of parking for his car $24.95, which I thought was quite excessive. I suppose we could have complained, but we didn't realize it until after checkout. Also, there was not an extra roll of toilet paper in the room, so we had to hunt down the housekeeper when we ran out. Otherwise we had a very enjoyable stay and would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greywolf115
Reviews.Content: We did alot of reviewing of hotels in the Montreal,down town area and very glad,that we chose this one. It is within walking distance of almost everything. The hotel itself is very up to date and very secure. You need your room key card to enter different section of the hotels,including to be able to operate the elevator. We ate one night at the hotel restaurant,it was just ok.Venture out,cause there is some great places to eat. The pool and ho tub,are on the roof section of the hotel,which is very nice. Also an area to lounge on the roof,with great views of the city. The hotel has it's own underground parking. It was like 20 dollars a day but believe well worth it,knowing your car is in a secured place. Overall,a great hotel and a great comfortable stay.Would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel..!”
Reviews.Author: markfrost
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn over the weekend of 17th - 19th September 2010 and i have to say what a fantastic hotel it is. The staff are so friendly and helpful, the hotel is really clean and looks amazing. My room was huge and the bed was so comfy, I will definatley come back to stay at this hotel and hopefully next year bring my family along aswell.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Christian377
Reviews.Content: Great location to walk around the city, and close to many bars, restaurants and attractions. Comfortable, clean rooms and helpful staff. I would stay there again if I visit Montreal again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: amyjemesouviens
Reviews.Content: It was perfect! The location and the luxury of this Hilton Garden were perfect! The room was huge and the bed was like a cloud! The location in Centre-ville MontrÃ©al was ideal because we could leave the car in the garage and walk or take the metro to everywhere we wanted to be. The gym was so awesome! It had great equipment and the size of it was amazing! It had a gigantic area with a pool and hot tub and even a rooftop area to sit out in the sun! I recommend this hotel completely.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, roomy, decent staff, good location, a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: dragek
Reviews.Content: To start with had a few problems in finding the hotel using the satellite navigation as it takes you to the wrong address. Apparently this is a common problem so watch out. Anyway after arriving at the hotel which is ideally situated. Front of House staff were very polite and helpful. The front door staff kindly were helpful with our car and took the lugage to the room and no pressures of a tip (even though we did.) We booked a quite which was big and airy and well maintained although the views are not great. Starbucks coffee in the room, with fridge, microwave and kitchen. We do not normally like this however it was all very clean and well maintained. The hotel has a large gym with plenty of cardio machines, just not much in terms of free weights, could do with more. The pool is an average size and is heated and there is a nice deck area to get some sun when it is out. The restaurant and bar (with pavement seating) isnâ€™t large but food is of good quality and excellent service, although a little pricey at the moment compared to the GBP. Overall the hotel is ideal location, well maintained, excellent staff and has everything you would expect from a city hotel. The only downside which I didnâ€™t appreciate is that we asked for a roll-a-way bed for our son, which wasnâ€™t in the room on arrival. They kindly put this in but both the reception and house keeping staff failed to tell us of a $12.95 charge a night, this is â€œsneakly writtenâ€� on an acceptance sheet. Firstly be careful of any hidden charges and secondly even though they failed to tell you, they will not waiver this even though they are in the wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: just_journeying
Reviews.Content: We opted for the breakfast package and glad we did. The breakfasts were cooked to order and was so filling that we weren't hungry until mid-afternoon. (Probably too much food for small kids though.) The room was comfy, but wish we wouldn't have been on the end. Getting to the lobby from the parking garage is more than a little tricky. We went up the wrong elevator and ended up in the private apartment lobby that shares the tower. Luckily their door man was helpful. The pool, spa, workout area and upper deck were usually desserted when we went there. The pool guy made sure everything was clean and picked up which made going there pleasant. The front desk could have been more in tune with the happenings in town as they didn't mention that the Biodome was closed due to a strike until we got there. We found the location just right for us to get to all the sights we wished to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ironleague
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Montreal with my wife for a getaway and was very pleased with our stay at Hilton Garden Inn. I will break things down by positives and negatives (although there are few negatives) Negatives. - Shower down leaked, one light in Bathroom was out (however I did not bother contacting the front desk) - Parking was almost $50.00 after taxes for two nights - View from room was not great (back alley) - A bit pricy ($525.00 for two nights) although I guess this is the norm for Montreal in the summer. Postives - Great location close to shopping, Metro, Crescent Street, Place de Arts, McGill University, restaurants and only 20 minute walk to Old Port - Beautifully decorated hotel and rooms. - Spacious room (although I think we had a room for the disabled) - Very comfotable bed, we slept great!) - Very nice pool, hottub and rooftop deck. - Very safe and secure parking. - Awesome shower stall - Great High Speed Internet There are probably more positives that I forgot but all in all we were very pleased. If you can accept the high price, it is worth staying here. Great for families too, from what I can tell. We will stay here again. Merci Hilton Graden Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: DarlaMaria
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. I chose Montreal as a vacation spot because of the walking and biking options. A Bixi bike station is across the street from the hotel. The hotel appears new. We were given a room with only a shower -- not a major issue for us, but it seemed odd that we were not given a choice between tub or shower. (Again, a minor issue.) WE LOVED THE STEAM ROOM. Major issue: Non-availability of parking in garage. Parking is $21.50 per day (unlimited entries/exits). However, by early evening every night the designated spaces were filled. One night, there were about 10 cars lined up, waiting for a staff member to open the gate to allow us to park on the 6th level. (We had to wait approximately 20 minutes for someone to arrive.) I recommend driving around the block to an outdoor lot ($11 per day). Cleaning issue: The carpet in the Circo restaurant needs to be cleaned (or replaced if that's not really dirt).

Reviews.Title: “Great service and great coffee”
Reviews.Author: gil014
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with the positive reviews for this hotel. The friendliness and service could not be better. I especially liked the starbucks coffee being available in our room. The staff was very helpful with directions. The site is walking distance to the Beaux Arts Museum and the cathedral of Notre Dame. We will definitely stay at this hotel again if we are lucky enough to visit Montreal again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sul2400
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers to Montreal, and we've stayed in lots of hotels in the downtown area. We chose the Hilton Garden Inn Centre-Ville based on the reviews on Tripadvisor. It was pricey, but the reviews made it seem like it's worth it. Unfortunately, it wasn't The good: the hotel is in a good location. The facilities seem relatively new. The bed was comfortable and adjustable. The bad: many have mentioned the shower OR bath issue, so there's no need to repeat here. We weren't given a choice and got a room with a floor, walk-in shower, which wasn't our preference. The gym looks good on the surface, but the equipment is cheap and flimsy, especially the treadmills. Finally, our room wasn't cleaned; they simply forgot to do it. To be fair, we got some apologies from the management and an offer to clean it around 7:30 pm (which means we would have had to leave the room), but it was really too late because we were tired and wanted to rest. In all, we won't be returning to this hotel. Overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton Garden Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Katchapuri
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we were attending aconference, which was spread over the Fairmont, Hyatt, Hilton, Sheraton and Palais de Congres. The Garden Inn was within a 10-15 min. walk to each of these locations, as well as the restaurants on St. Laurent, Prince Arthur and St Denis, and was much better value for money. The property is just 2 years old and is located on the first 11 floors of a high rise condo building. Each room has the standard HGI microwave, fridge and free internet and the new adjustable mattresses. The rooms number ---01 are corner rooms and a bit bigger than the others. As HHonors Diamond members, we were given breakfast vouchers, which was a great buffet with wonderful baguettes and strawberry chocolate crepes! All of the staff were very friendly and helpful, despite the hotel operating at full capacity. The only negative was that on the 3rd day our room was being cleaned when we got back at 6 pm. However a quick call to the front desk asking for a morning cleaning the remainder of the stay was all that was needed. It was fun to try out some of the BYOB restaurants on and off of St Laurent and there is a conveniently located SAQ on St Laurent to buy the wine that stays open late. Failing that, you can buy a bottle at Provigo across the street from the hotel. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “More praise for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Homespunner
Reviews.Content: I can only add to the praise this hotel has received in other reviews. Spacious, clean room with well-appointed bathroom. Comfortable bed. Quiet room (granted, we were on the end, on the rear side of the hotel). While waiting for my friend to retrieve something from the car, I was politely asked by two bell hops if I needed assistance with our bags. It is a short walk to the Museum of Fine Art, the Contemporary Art Museum, Old Montreal, Parc du Mont-Royal, McGill, etc. And the price was very competitive. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: nbjuls
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about at all. it was very good and exceeded my expectations. The room was nice, the housekeeping was excellent, the front desk staff and staff i met in hallways was the nicest . Had a chance to use the pool it was nice, loved the location of it. Nice views while swiming. I booked this hotel because of location and also that they offered some nice secure parking. Which was a big concern for me...I must say the location was perfect for me and the parking was the best. I would stay again anytime I go to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dinesh R
Reviews.Content: The hotel was simply great. The rooms were large and accommodated the four of us quite easily. Washroom was clean and chic. And the breakfast included in our package was sumptous. Parking was slight expensive at $22 per night but at least it was safe and conveniently located within the hotel. But the best part was the location at Sherbrooke street, just a few minutes drive from the Mount Royal Parc, a walk away from downtown Montreal and a drive away from Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fabulous room service!”
Reviews.Author: OttawaCat314
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and was pleasantly surprised. I was quickly checked in by the pleasant front desk staff, given a fabulous, clean room, the bed was really comfortable, and even the elevators were quick. The location is great, lots of restaurants and entertainment nearby, I can't think of anything bad to say about this hotel. I did want to comment on the unusually remarkable room service! Usually the menus are hamburgers and club sandwiches, with tiny portions and quality on par with Denny's for outrageous prices. I ordered a Prosciutto, Brie and Pears on homemade flat bread and I was blown away. This was closer to five star dining, and it came with a mountain of fries(some of the best fries Ive ever had) that I wasn't even able to finish. Kudos to your room service. That alone is worth coming back here!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best Staff”
Reviews.Author: Iwantitallnow
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a fair number of hotels over the years and the staff at this one are the best I have ever encountered. My family found the front desk people just so friendly and helpful. The young lady who checked us in saw me in the parking garage several hours after we checked in and greeted me by name. She was then kind enough to give me directions to some of the local points of interest even though she was off duty. The rest of the staff were equally ready to be helpful. The room itself was quite nice, my daughter loved how soft the pillows were and rates all other pillows against these. The top floor pool has a nice view of the area and is long, if a little narrow. The restaurant on the ground floor was excellent, too. We had it all to ourselves since we ate at seven PM, way early by Montreal standards I think. The food was delicious and the wait staff were very pleasant and seemed genuinely concerned that we enjoyed dinner, which of course we did. We had a wonderful stay in this property and recommend it for anybody wanting to stay in downtown Montreal. The secure parking in the basement is a huge plus in a downtown setting.

Reviews.Title: “New, large rooms, central location, clean”
Reviews.Author: Tinygoat
Reviews.Content: I cannot say anything negative about this hotel. In fact, after staying here I went to Quebec City and it was hard to enjoy my hotel there after how modern, clean and spacious the room at the Hilton Garden Inn had been. It is a real treat to stay in a new hotel in Montreal. Most hotels I have ever stayed in while in Montreal have that "faux new" look where they've just painted over old fixtures for an updated look. This hotel is new, no doubt. The pool was great (and open until 11PM), with a good view of Montreal (although hard to see out at night, but whatever). I would stay here again for work OR pleasure. No complaints at all. Walking distance to everything: shopping, le Plateau, Saint Laurent, McGill. And it's located near Parc Avenue, so there are grocery stores, etc. to pick up snacks - and the hotel rooms have micros and fridges. Thanks Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Vikram_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel from July 31st to August 2nd with my family. First trip in years to Montreal. We had a blast. After much browsing of reviews, I picked this hotel and we were not disappointed. Excellent, clean, spacious rooms and bathrooms. Very clean, excellent service by the front desk and concierge. Christopher, the concierge on the evening of the 31st recommended and booked a restaurant for us in Old Montreal; Cafe de Franco. I was taken aback by his initiative. We thought we would have to go and book our own table, he did it for us. We had a awesome dinner there. All the staff I encountered seem to take pride in their work and the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel. Just a few drawbacks; treadmill in the gym needs to be replaced, parking in the two floors; 1 and 2 get filled pretty fast on weekends, especially when you return at night and then you are asked to self park on 6th level. Parking is around $22/day, maybe valet parking could be an option. Breakfast was great at the hotel; made to order eggs, were great. Awesome Depaneur (corner store) next to hotel. And great many cafes in the vicinity. Will definitely return and recommend Hilton Garden Inn, Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - everything they advertised was true”
Reviews.Author: canuck1st
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best hotel!! Recently 5 of us (one who is in an electric wheelchair) stayed at this hotel because out of the 7 other hotels I called regarding electric wheelchair & mobility accessiblity, this one was the only one who 1. had a staff member on the maiin desk that actually knew what I was talking about and was completely conversant with what the hotel offered and 2. had true accessibility. They have a room on each floor that is totally accessible. The doors are plenty wide, there are raised toilet seat, roll-in-shower - ( not a tub that you have to be able to get over the side of which is what all of the other hotel I talked to had), all the grab bars that could be needed, shower seat. lower counters & sink and plent of room to manouveur around the bed, desk etc.. Although accessibility was superb it was not the only great thing. Our other rooms were large enough and very comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful, kind, funny and knowledgeable. The hotel was spotless at all times. The restaurant food was very good, reasonably priced and again wonderful staff. With it's central location we walked to many of the sites. I have already passed on to a number of friends how wonderful our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn was.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is part of the success for a week-end”
Reviews.Author: le-papa-razzi
Reviews.Content: I simply make this hotel my "temporary home" in MontrÃ©al. Luxury hotel at affordable price The restaurent is great and not expensive compared to everything around. Dont miss Susan's smile at the bar and enjoy the nice "zen" terrasse. Enjoy the salt water pool! I've done them all... simply the best in Montreal for a reasonnable price

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: margaret5809
Reviews.Content: Four of us shared a 2 queen room. There was plenty of room for suitcases and shopping purchases. I was particularly impressed with the safety of the building. Our key had to be used in the elevator to get to our floor and our key only allowed us onto the floor with our room. The staff were friendly and helpful and always polite. Only one recommendation...swim in the very early morning to avoid the many boisterous children in a quite small yet pretty pool. The pool and exercise room are shared with apartment renters who occupy the upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! I wish all hotels were this good....”
Reviews.Author: Springer62
Reviews.Content: Hilton Garden Inns are our "go-to" hotels for many family vacations. They tend to be reliably middle-of-the-road..meaning good value for good service. This hotel, however, was well above that level of quality and service. Indeed, the service approached that of luxury resorts at which we've stayed. The room was spotlessly clean, with the furniture and fixtures in excellent condition. All was in working order. The bedding was the higher end "Evolution" bedding - very comfortable and cozy. Furniture style was standard for the chain. Elevators all required room keys for access to the upper floors - a nice touch to improve security in any city hotel. The restaurant was surprisingly excellent for a hotel restaurant and far superior to any restaurant at any other Hilton Garden Inn we've stayed at. Service was efficient and very professional. The breakfast, while the standard fare of the chain, was prepared excellently - I had one of the best omelets in memory and very tasty pancakes and French toast on various mornings. We also ate dinner there the first night and, again, were very pleased with the taste, selection and service. The pool is on the top floor. While I confess I don't know why they have a salt water pool, the kids enjoyed having a "different" type of pool. The pool and deck were very clean and were attended to frequently by a hotel employee. The view of the city from the pool deck (and the outside terrace, adjoining the deck) was wonderful, especially at night - you can see in three different directions, including a nice view of Mont Royal. What really made this hotel stand out, though, was the exceptional quality of the service. Every single employee we encountered - front desk clerks, hosts, waiters and waitresses, custodial employees, concierge and more - was friendly, helpful and genuinely seemed to care (instead of the phony "I care because I'm told to" attitude that so often is encountered in the service industry). Never having been to the city before, we asked many questions and all were answered promptly, courteously and accurately. My only wish is that every hotel could be this good....

Reviews.Title: “Montreal Grand Prix, Grand Hotel, and Grand Service!”
Reviews.Author: Lavant
Reviews.Content: My second stay at this hotel, and once again they did not disappoint! Despite the presence of all the hustle and bustle of the Montreal Grand Prix, the hotel staff were extremely well-organized and the hotel was as quiet and peaceful as it was during my last visit...and no waiting necessary for breakfast in their restaurant. Best part of the stay? My Hummer actually fit in their underground parking lot!

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: jrj42
Reviews.Content: Rooms clean and comfortable, but all else will nickel and dime you to death. Parking around the hotel is $10-$12 per day, but hotel charges $21 per day. $5 for coffee, $5 for a bagel. Room rate is deceptive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Montreal trip”
Reviews.Author: nazshrimpo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn from July 1 to July 4. Our room was great and the fridge and microwave came in handly. We asked for a kettle and it was delivered within minutes. We thought we didn't have towels and asked for some and they too arrived within minutes. All the staff (consierge, front desk, housekeeping, parking) went out of their way to help us, not just with finding our way around Montreal, but making sure we had everything we needed to make our stay wonderful. The location of the hotel was a bonus too. The only drawback was paying $24 for undergound parking, but hey, it was better than parking somewhere else. At least this way we knew the car was safe. All in all, great place. We would go there again - and ah yes, the beds were very comfortable. Thank you to all the staff at Hilton Garden Inn. See you again soon :) 3 lady friends.â€Ž

Reviews.Title: “Highest marks on all fronts”
Reviews.Author: Edik
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and two daughters during the opening weekend of the Jazz festival. The hotel was completely full, yet everything worked flawlessly - no waiting for elevators, efficient room service, etc. The location couldn't be better - easy access to both old town and other city attractions (and steps away from the festival). Large, clean rooms, super-comfortable beds, no issues with noise, great climate control system, clean, safe garage. My daughters enjoyed the pool - it is enclosed, but there is plenty of fresh air coming thru sliding doors leading to a roof deck. All in all, met and exceeded our expectations on all fronts! Bravo to the management team! And, on a separate note, here is a restaurant recommendation (15 min walk from hotel): Mbrgr - very hip, great food, not cheap but probably the most fun place in the city to take your older teens / young adults too - and you can enjoy watching their excitement while drinking Mojitos from a $49 pitcher :-)

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamAnita
Reviews.Content: This hotel is defenitely overpriced at +200 euros a night! It is very noisy: the room windows do not have sufficient glazing to keep out street noise and the rooms have very thin walls. This hotel had several bachelorparties which caused a lot of noise as well. When asked to get another room or at least free earplugs, hotelstaff refused to give the plugs that they themselves sell in their shop. Hotel was fully booked, so relocation was impossible. This hotel is part of the Hilton group, but doesn't meet Hilton standards. The bathroom was very small, no bath and the blankets were uncomfortable as well. I have stayed at the Montreal Sheraton prior to this stay, and have slept better and more quiet there, for a lower rate. Pluspoint: free wifi

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SameerBansal
Reviews.Content: Hilton Montreal downtown is very well located on sharebroke street and is close to major downtown areas. The hotel offer great restro in ground floor and soothing pool and work out area on top floor....ameneties and service is top class. It came for ~ 140 CAD which for location and service was a great value. For business traveller or people going for fun hotel is ideally located ...:))

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: soozieQzie
Reviews.Content: Our group of four adults stayed in two rooms on the 4th floor. The rooms were spotless and very large. The beds were very comfortable and nicely made up. The work desk was big enough to actually do some work, and had a very nice office chair so you would be comfortable. Good blackout curtains kept the room dark in the morning. The free WiFi was the best I've ever had at a hotel--fast and reliable. Starbucks coffee and a fridge in the room were appreciated. The pool on the 11th floor is a nice area to spend some time, very bright with nice indoor and outdoor seating areas. My only complaint was the loud sound of slamming doors in the hallways late at night and early in the morning. This seems to be a common occurrence in newer hotels that have heavy doors that close automatically. Most people don't think to try to close them quietly, so everyone else suffers. I don't count this as a real strike against the hotel, but it would be nice if someone in the industry could come up with a way to have those doors close softly.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: jocko13
Reviews.Content: Business circumstances arose to have me travel to Montreal. There were no second thoughts as to where I would stay, the Hilton garden Inn downtown Montreal. Upon checking in, the desk staff were very friendly and I was in my room within minutes. The room was bright ,clean and very welcoming. NO SURPRISES!! On my second day, I went swimming in the salt water pool which refreshed and revived me. The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance to shopping, to a variety of restaurants ( Sushi,Italian ,Vietnamese,Greek,French and not to far from a great deli. I don't know why anyone would want to stay at any other hotel. To the management, Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Has Hilton Standard. Clean, beautiful and good location”
Reviews.Author: Minoue-Sisteron
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of Hilton standard hotel. Big room, confortable bed, nice view and clean room. Stuff was very helpful as well. Top floor gym and swimming pool is definitely worth checking. Sham it was raining when we were there, but there is terrace and should have nice view of the city. Downtown location and walkable to every sightseeing spots.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: amtrak58
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here on business. Amenties were standard HGI. The restaurant has a great outdoor seating area... terrific for a drink. Fitness center is on the 11th floor - the city views were a nice change of pace. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Couple of downsides - the speed of the internet service was extremely slow... I had better luck with my wireless card. And the elevator access to/from the parking garage is a bit confusing and inconvenient. There are two sets of elevators from the garage - one to the hotel, the other to a condo building above the hotel. Neither is well marked... I wound up in the lobby of the condo building more than once. And the elevators for the hotel only access the first two levels of the four level garage... plan on having to take the stairs if you wind up parking on levels 3 or 4.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: greatbeyond
Reviews.Content: We had a really great stay at the Hilton Garden Inn in Montreal. Check-in was great - we got to check in early cause they had a room available. The check-in staff was very welcoming and took care of all our questions. They even had someone make sure our car fit in the underground parking (we have a Navigator) which is about $24 a day but we never had to use it while we were there and it's easier than looking for street parking. Location is great, short walk to Rue St. Laurant which has good shopping and nightlife. Also close to a bunch of metro stops and Old Montreal. The room was very very clean. The bed had a knob to adjust firmness. The hair dryer in the bathroom had a nozzle which I love because my hair can be particularly unruly. The front desk staff was very helpful in making reservations for us (btw - Mastro S.V.P. has great seafood!) and for giving us recommendations (Scwartz's for lunch - delicious). Breakfast is not included and was $14.95. We opted to eat outside and get a bit more atmosphere than the hotel lobby. The gym and pool are fabulous. The view is amazing and indoor pools are always awesome. But there were no towels anywhere! I've read that in other reviews but did see some people with towels but have no idea where they got them. We asked the attendant who was cleaning the pool where to get them and he said we had to bring one from the room. It didn't make sense to me as the ones in the room are not pool towels. The gym also did not have any towels. Check out was also very easy and they let us leave the car for the day as we walked around. Also free internet in the rooms! Overall a great stay. The biggest issue was the pool towels!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: T0r0nt0_Girl_25
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect spot in downtown Montreal. Super close to everything, I was able to walk anywhere I wanted to go. The staff was excellent and very friendly, made it feel like a home away from home. The hotel was super clean with beautiful amenities. My room was large and spacious and the fridge and microwave were the perfect additions to have in any room. I stayed 3 nights in a king size room and it was perfect. The underground parking is very secure which was comforting as I was a solo female traveler. I would absolutely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a hotel in downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, I am in the middle of my stay rignt now and I wanted to write something nice while I am still here.”
Reviews.Author: ladowpink
Reviews.Content: This place is great. The staff is great. I cannot say enough nice things about this hotel. I plan to write a more detailed review upon my return home

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: OCCTRAVELE
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, location; can't beat the price for the type of room provided. Great dining, close to everything downtown. The steam room is really the cherry on top of the ice cream. I would sugguest other hotel chains send their managers to this loction to learn how to treat guests.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the night life type!”
Reviews.Author: FrqntTrvllr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a bunch of girls over New Year's Eve- location was perfect... close to St. Laurent night life, and shopping. We walked just about everwhere except for Old Montreal, which we could easily done if it weren't winter. Rooms were also a good size, affordable, and clean with good service. The free internet/business centre also came in handy. Overall the perfect Montreal hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value from Hilton in Downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: ottwatrvlr
Reviews.Content: After reading the many positive reviews about this relatively new Hilton property in Montreal, I decided to give it a try. Hilton has three offering DT Montreal: -The Hilton Bonaventure, which is conveniently located next to the train station. This is the oldest property but has recently been renovated. It tends to be the most expensive as it is a "full service" hotel (higher end restaaurant, rooftop pool, executive lounge...) As such it caters more to the business traveller -The Embassy Suites is located next to the Congress Centers and steps away from Old Montreal. It is relatively new and its "suites" makes it a good option for larger families and tourists seeking a mix of good value with above average room amenities (many rooms feature fireplace, jet tub and a kitchen with appliances). -The Garden Inn, located close to McGill University and the downtown shopping district (Ste.Catherine street - Eaon Centre, The Bay,...) It offers great value (it is often the least expensive of the three) and features contemporary "standard" rooms with relatively standard room amenities (the microwave may be the only non-standard item) A little bit more about the Garden Inn as this is a review about this hotel!!! Hotel Location: Very convenient for friends/family of McGill Student. Metro station (underground) a couple of blocks away. A decent spot for business as well as it is close to some of the business skyscrapers (Sherbrooke Street). If driving and coming from the southern part of Downtown (Ville-Marie Expressway, South Shore...) this means that you will have to go "through" downtown which maybe a little annoying during rush hour. If arriving by train, it is a short taxi ride and it is walkable (surface or in part through the underground path). Subway/Metro is not really an option as the Train station (Bonaventure, Orange Line 2) and the Hotel (McGill, Green Line 1) are on separate line and would require backtracking. Reception / Check-in Open space, modern and contemporary. Very friendly, bilingual (English and French) staff. Efficient. As this was my first time at this location, was offered a review of all amenities services Rooms If you have been into of of the "newest" Hilton Garden Inn, the room will look very familiar. From a design perspective, it is very consistent with the "corporate" look of this brand. It is modern/contemporary, yet relatively basic. The bed is adjustable (for comfort/firmness) and you have yous standard choice of pillows (feather/foam/hypoallergenic). Room also has a work desk, TV, microwave... The bathroom is of good size and feature and "stand-up" shower only (no bathtub). Bathroom amenities feature the standard amenities for this chain: Neutrogena products. As I was on the top floor, facing Sherbrooke Street, I had a farily unobtructed view of Mount Royal, and a direct view of the illuminated cross at night. Only one negative about the particular room that I was in. It was getting very noisy at times - I realized that the room was located right above the hot tub located in the exercise area. Free high speed internet included Restaurants Unfortunately, I cannot comment on food quality as my schedule did not allow me to grab a meal there. However, the offering appears to fit with the hotel - ie: young, modern, contemporary. Montreal has a lot to offer food-wise and there are several restaurants withing walking distance that will acoomodate almost any budgets Exercise/Pool Located on the top floor, this may be one of the best feature of the hotel. Many of the newer Garden Inns do relatively well in this area (as far as quality of equipment) but they use very small rooms to put everything. The exercise and pool area is very large and offers "panoramic" views of Montreal. There are several treadmills, bikes and ellipticals to choose from. Unfortunately, the equipment does not feature individual TVs, which I find a nice distraction while exercising. When you get out of the exercise room, be careful as some of the doors lead to an appartment/condo complex attached to the hotel Other: For security reason, one has to use room key in elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Easter Weekend in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Lappy01
Reviews.Content: Drove from Ottawa to Montreal. Stayed in a king suite. Small bathroom without a bathtub (only shower) and found the beb uncomfortable. Nice quality (newly built). Location is great if attending festivals (downtown just East of McGill Universtity). No surprises and while we generally enjoyed our stay, we did not find the hotel stood out in anyway (for a new facility).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel right downtown”
Reviews.Author: syncopation1234
Reviews.Content: Steps from McGill University. Right downtown. Secure (you need your room key card to take the elevator to your floor). Our booking included breakfast, $14 dollars per room extra per night and got full breakfast for 4 - not too shabby (and the breakfast was good...). Parking is reasonably priced, secure garage, with in/out privileges... we asked and they let us keep our car in the garage for a couple of extra hours after check out (you should ask though...!).

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like Coming Home!”
Reviews.Author: T7210
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I stay at this hotel, and I can honestly say that my return felt like I was coming home. I even extended my stay for one night because I felt like I was at a get away spa. They have an amazing salt water pool where I lounged half the day and an amazing gym where I burned some of those calories I ate! When I returned to my room , I wanted to relax and order room service and after my meal was completed they called to ask me if I would like to have Coffee and Dessert. I have never seen that in any hotel I have stayed at! Simply amazing...as was the food... for all you pizza lovers, try the pizza with Prociutto ..out of this world! The beds at this hotel are sooooo comftroble...and you will have no problem staying in them watching the plasma TV! I cant give the staff there enough credit... being a woman travelling alone, I stay away from some of the Bars in hotels , NOT THIS ONE...the bartender was a breath of fresh air, and paid as much attention to me ordering a tisane as she did to the customers ordering full meals and beers. Even the other guests I met in the bussiness center (where I used the internet and computer for free) had all good things to say. I also like being in walking distance to the great shopping...the only thing I dont recommend is the little snack place next door that I decided to try on my first night....it was cheap..and you get what you pay for....Trust me ..TRY THE HOTEL PIZZA.... The breakfast at this hotel is an all you can eat, and there are no trays of food waiting to be scooped up. You order what you want..I ordered an omlette with my choice of ingredients, and then I had some fruit and yogurt....and a little bit of waffles..lol

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: T-dot_Traveller_76
Reviews.Content: As a business traveller this hotel had everything I needed. It was extremely clean, the service was great and I liked the office space in the room. There is a Provigo (grocery store) very close by which is extremely convenient. All in all, I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Furieri
Reviews.Content: Check in and check out was quickly (actually, there was no check out procedure, since the receit was at the front door on my departure day). The hotel is brand new, its location is very good, the business center was at hand, staff was nice, wireless internet worked fine, room was spotless. I wish all hotels worked like this one.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificient location and lots of lesure”
Reviews.Author: lilnastyrose
Reviews.Content: Close to st.catharine street and not far from old montreal, beautiful hotel, average size room with good service. Heated swimming pool on the roof with lifeguard, calming music and hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely updated, good location”
Reviews.Author: sjkel
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 10th floor with 2 queen beds. The rooms are an average size- especially for a downtown hotel. Pros: - Nicely updated - Very clean - Good beds (sleep number + down comforter/pillows) - Mini fridge, microwave, and coffee pot with Starbucks and liquid cream - Free wi-fi - Underground parking - Good breakfast choices (we paid for breakfast + room option which was a good deal for the three of us.) - Nice concierge, front desk and maids - Good bathrooms- small but really beautiful and had everything - Flat screen t.v. with cable, some channels in Eng and some in French (I didn't count, maybe around 70 channels?) - Clean saltwater pool, great workout area and steam room - Non smoking hotel Cons - Cannot order movies- its simply not offered - Pool was 81 degrees F- kind of chilly - Hot tub was out of service- getting re-tiled - Hot tub workers started working on chipping tiles at 7 am on our sleep-in morning! Ugh! (our room was right below it. Although the front desk said others on diff. floors complained too.) We noticed they started at the same time the next day, although we had to be up early that day. All together it was a good experience- great if we could have a hot tub, more recent movies (we still caught some older good movies on the t.v. which turned out fine) and no workers before 10am. We stayed at a different hotel in Montreal last year and it was dated and dirty, so we were so happy with this experience, even the cons didn't get us down. I travelled with my mom who is very forgiving of a less than perfect place, but I definitely could come back here with my husband who has very high standards for ambience. Next winter I would stay here again only if the hot tub is working. Travelling with a kid, a clean indoor pool is a must for her, but a hot tub is a must for me!

Reviews.Title: “Beats the Sheraton Le Centre HANDS DOWN”
Reviews.Author: heward
Reviews.Content: Usually stay at Sheraton.. but not any more - clean rooms, Digital temperature control (not at Sherton's high class rooms), flatscreen, Microwave& fridge (bonus), Free internet. Great location and very safe - nice fitness room and pool as well (basic - but highquality for holel - large area new machines and EXCELLENT steam room)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: PeonyPenelope
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn was such a great choice of a place to stay. My sister and I traveled to Montreal to shop and relax. We LOVED the rooftop saltwater pool, the jacuzzi, and the steam room! The service at the hotel was great. The front desk receptionists were extremely friendly and helpful, they even let us check in early which was awesome. The parking was quick and convenient and comfortable since the garage is heated. Our room was comfortable, quiet, and very clean. We ate dinner and breakfast at the restaurant and had very nice meals. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value...Well received.... Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Luciano11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on the reccomendation of friends, From the moment we arrived to the time we left, the staff was always very attentive to detail and made our stay a very plesant one. Hotel was very clean... well-situtated and I would definately reurn again....

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, they put a DENVER BOOT on my car for no reason!!!!”
Reviews.Author: the_big_legoski
Reviews.Content: If you're an honest, hard-working person who doesn't want to be hassled, don't even think of staying here. They put a DENVER BOOT on my car for no good reason (their parking system) I almost missed an important meeting because of it. I returned the following day for an explanation and an apology, the general manager was insulting, rude and dismissive Actually, it's the worst display of Customer service I've seen in my life, and this guy is a supposed VP!!!!. There are PLENTY of other hotels in the same neighborhood like the Courtyard Marriott, L'Appartement, the Holiday Inn, the Sofitel and Hotel Opus. Do yourself a favor and choose anything but the Hilton Garden Inn downtown Montreal!!!

Reviews.Title: “great new hotel in great location; let's hope they keep up with the maintenance”
Reviews.Author: mr.weinerdog
Reviews.Content: When I see a new hotel when planning a trip, well I am inclined to give it shot. Why? Well - it's new! And that means clean- really, I am tired of the stained carpets and fingerprint laden walls of so many so called 4+ star establishment. And this hotel didn't disappoint. Clean, well appointed rooms with nice linens. The bathrooms are small, but very functional really. The exercise room is amongst the best I have seen anywhere and the pool and hot tub were very nice - although I worry about their longevity (those glass mosaic tiles may look nice, but hey are already starting to come unglued; my daughter even cut her foot on a missing tile in the hot tub). But the best part- the steam room! Awesome. I will return just for that. My only complaints- other than the failing tiles in the pool and hot-tub- are minor. We checked in on a SAturady and there were dirty dishes from room service in the hallway. THose dishes sat there until Monday, even though the cleaning staff would have walked by them several times. Also the cleaning of our room on Sunday was, well, not really what I would call a cleaning (hey it's Winter here- you need to vacuum everyday). The cleaning staff seemed much improved on Monday and the room was again made spotless. THe included breakfast (need to book the breakfast rate) was great and the service excellent (better on Monday than Sunday again; cooking was opposite though- much beter prepared on the weekend). All in all, a great hotel with great rates. I will be back. Just keep that steam room functioning! Spotles

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel at a Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: le_mike_toronto
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, and make it a point to stay there whenever I'm in Montreal. I actually look forward to staying there. Here's why: 1. The rooms are huge and clean, and the beds are awesome (you can adjust the firmness - which works for me). The chair at the desk in my room is ultra comfortable. There's free internet (cable and wifi). 2. They have Starbucks coffee in the rooms, not that cheap bargain cr@p! They also don't have a mini-bar with mega-expensive drinks. Instead, they have a clean mini-fridge that I can use for OJ, soda pop, beer, or whatever. 3. The gym is huge with modern equipment. It's on the top floor in a large area with high ceilings, large windows and a great view. 4. The staff are polite, efficient, and friendly. They take great care of me whenever I'm there. 5. The location is great - right across from the McGill University area. 6. Almost forgot to mention: the shower heads are really good. I could go into the minutia of the benefits of staying here, but suffice it to stay that I have always had great experiences staying there, and those to whom I have recommended this hotel reported back to me after their stays that they were equally impressed. Bottom line: Great hotel, great location, great price.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: GianniRB
Reviews.Content: I stay at a lot of Hilton Hotels, but the Hilton Garden Inn really made me appreciate staying at a Hilton. The rooms were so quiet and peaceful, I spent as much time as possible there, relaxing. I would highly recommend this Hilton to anyone looking for a hotel room that will relieve your stress.

Reviews.Title: “Good Amenities, Excellent Location...”
Reviews.Author: sierratango1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. This hotel is at an excellent location, right on Rue Sherbrooke Ouest (West). We found that the property was fairly new, and well maintained. All of the staff we encountered spoke French & English, and happily switched between both based on our interaction. The rooms were extremely clean. Having free access to WiFi, as well as a microwave and refrigerator in the room were really helpful. The bathroom in *our* room did not have a tub (may be a concern for some - not an issue for us). Staying at this hotel will put you within walking distance of the Metro (Place-des-Arts), as well as restaurants/shopping (Rue. St. Catherine, etc). The hotel offers underground parking for $20 (CAD) a day. We didn't experience a problem finding a spot in their facility, and left the car there for the duration of our stay (walked and used the Metro). Overall, I was very pleased with our stay at this hotel. I have visited Montreal several times, and have stayed at a couple of other properties.
